Np2TtZtsPR9K4IO3sI9Enw.text: I go to Zipps restaurants all over the valley. This Zipps is by far my favorite. The staff is great. The portions are large. The beer is cold. It's my go to spot.

EQaksleYID-O9GkehDwo6Q.text: I hate to write this review. They used to be really good. Now their food was just plain bad. I couldn't believe how bad their food had dropped. I had the fish and chips and they were soggy and the fries were soo greasy. Sorry to say, I also had their wings and they were the worst wings I've had in a long time. The only reason I'm not giving them a 1 star is because they used to be really good and I hope they fix their menu. I personally wont be going back to this location. Other locations still have good food!

dwJ4IdfJA7MFiHz8eJDJTg.text: How cool that it's 'no problem' to go off the menu!!  I ordered a quesadilla and asked if they could put steak tenderloin on there- yum!!

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. How nice to sit out @ the fire pit n watch the game!

xL0FurAmyRTAcVFNTcRPzw.text: Zipps!   One of the Valley's best happy hour if you're looking for a laid-back atmosphere, I really enjoy the layout of this location.  A 32-ouncer and Golden Medium wings are a must! But don't underestimate the strong margaritas. Yummy Burgers, and AMAZING foccacias.   A great sports bar to watch the bigger games. NFL, NBA, MLB, and college. Although, my boyfriend and I feel that there are too many U of A fans. (GO DEVILS!)

uOeRmTYExWoyyE8hDW0yow.text: Best wings in Phoenix. My fave are the golden wings, medium; prepared like hot wings but a bit sweeter. Order wings hot and the server will warn you and you can't send them back.

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Golden wings!

NtxAuSSJRTdDdIhvZkqAvQ.text: Ah, happy hour with the same people I spend more time with than my own family. What a treat! We're always on the lookout for a centrally located bar/restaurant to meeting with our various coworkers, who are spread out from the Biltmore, Midtown, Downtown and Gateway (and some times Mesa). Zipp's Indian School fit into our rotation this month.   This location has been open only a couple of weeks, from what I heard, and they seemed to have pretty much everything down. The service was good, the beers were awesome (the tap beers didn't have their own menu, which I'd prefer. But I had a dark ale and for the life of me cannot remember what it was because two large beers later and I was toast...1557 or something like that). It's loud inside, so this wouldn't be a location to consider if you're planning an important business transaction...unless, of course, that business transaction had something to do with cement boots and Tempe Town Lake. Since I had a late lunch, I wasn't hungry but my fellow coworkers enjoyed their onion rings and chicken strips.   Nothing too impressive about the bathrooms. The stalls have very low doors so you can't see if anyone's in there, and if you happen to be like me and try a door that isn't locked you'll walk in on a lightweight hurling. Blech! And the single urinal seems like a lack of consideration, considering this place is a sports bar and beer flows freely. But, I guess that's what male bonding is all about. Right? IDK.   Parking is at a premium during happy hour, so plan accordingly. I lucked out and landed rock star parking because I made a few laps around the lot.   We'll likely return here for a future happy hour. Until then, good luck in the parking lot, drink well, and don't tap the keg until you're good and ready.

UMwE7_tc47dp9gWuKfUtJw.text: Ok so I loooovveee zipps wings and zipperitas oh and the burgers but the service ...two thumbs down.  I'm not sure how this happened but the past 3x we have gotten the same waiter and she's just not nice. My friend ordered something that she did not like and they made an issue about us returning the item.  The manager was even unfriendly when he came to check as to why we didn't like the food, he seemed annoyed and was unapologetic.  Going to try the Bethany locations of forward.  Good bye indian school.

iTTgWlGvXk_cccttUbTq6Q.text: Great drink specials is the only reason I come here. The service isnt good at all. Server constantly forgot one of our friends drink, kept our IDs for more than 30 minutes, drinks didnt reach us within 15 min.. Had to remind her for water more than once. They close their kitchen early so say goodbye to bar food. Server also kept one of our credit cards because she thought we would leave early. Overall, zipps was a bad vibe and I wouldnt come here unless someone forced me to.

cWg4JrosSUsN7zYDED8qVg.text: You know those douchebags that yell and scream at the television and chest bump after every play on Sundays? You can find them here. This is one of the reasons I like this place, because I can be one of those douchebags.  On Sundays it gets PACKED here. My friends snagged a spot early today so I just pulled up a chair to their table. You can hardly walk around the place. Normally this would anger me, but if I can see my football team play I could care less.  They have all the televisions labeled with the games of the day so you can make sure you have a good view of your team's game. From what I've been told, the owner seems to be a Patriots fan, because almost every Sunday that is the game that has the sound streaming. Totally fine by me.  If you are going to watch the Cardinals game, GET THERE EARLY. Or else you will be standing at the entrance squinting at the televisions, waiting for your table to be ready.  Food is typical bar food. They have specials on Sundays on drinks and food so you don't spend a lot of money getting trashed and trash talking the Dallas (or whatever team you despise) fan next to you.  If you like to enjoy a football game without people looking at you like you are crazy, this is the place to go.

tQ1ahklYpfoXJrCrlR4Bzw.text: Come see Anna for amazing drinks!! She makes the best lemondrop martini in the industry!! Her mixology skills are bomb.com and her southern charm makes you feel right at home! Thanks Anna for making my days off so great!! :)

yqtSUR8gbiZDdcf8GTOdEQ.text: Zipps is my favorite sports bar because it has an upscale atmosphere and great food & drink specials. Happy hour  is from 4pm-7pm and reverse happy hour is 8pm-close. On Saturday and Sunday you can take advantage of their hangover specials from 11am-4pm. See why I love this bar?  The food here is hit or miss. If you stick with the appetizers, wings, and burgers you'll be okay. I just tried the big zip burger with tartar sauce and it was amazing! I know tartar sauce on a burger sounds weird but it was really good and not as weird as it sounds.   The bar serves beer, wine, liquor. I highly recommend trying a margarita. They taste just like Z TEJAS and they only let you have 3. Skip the bloody marys they smell like garbage.  This is a good place to watch Sunday football. You can yell as loud as you want and people don't look at you like you're crazy. Sometimes I yell for the fun of it. Sunday's are busy make sure you get here early so you can get a good table.

k222uuXSR6qJdSkXLzIgGA.text: GOLDEN WINGS! That's all I have to say about that......  ZIPPARITAS! That's all I have to say about that too....  My only gripe is that from time to time you get an unattentive waitress who you will end up having to call back over. I mean, come on! Who's tippin' who here???  Besides THAT, I loves ya Zipp's.  The end.

Oik7g_W2PiNxs6gYQK4D1A.text: New to the Zipps atmosphere. Very busy place. Standing room only in the evenings. Lots of staff to help you but time is not on your side. Food was luke warm when it came. Wings were dry. Pizza was burnt. Although it tasted good just was a off night I will assume. The hamburger is huge but full of flavor. Single patty price is alittle high when you compare it to the normal double burger price. Beer prices are great. Margarita is perfect. It's a sports grill but definitely not geared for a family dining. Which is disappointing. Families like to watch sports together. I would never bring my kids into this atmosphere.

ShWGk1xO3qb0x96FI7xCVw.text: Fish tacos wrapped in flour tortilla and sauce were terrible.   The volume on the TV was obnoxiously too loud.  There were 8 of us and you could only hear the person next to you.  Price for a pitcher of beer was reasonable.

vRk7k7njjBOL9DufhnCiMg.text: I hate to even write a bad review,  but in this case I feel I must.   The experience was bad.    My boyfriend and I met met some friends at Zipps for lunch, and some drinks on Sat.  The restuarant was not super busy.  Our server was not attentive at all.   During our dining we had to continuously remove all of our own glassware, and dirty plates. Literally 6 empty glasses at a time.   Then she forgot our second drink order. When she finally got around to bringing it, I asked her for a pickle. She rudley smirked and said, "we do not have pickles."  I know this was not even True since probably 98% of all sportsbars in America have pickles.   I was a little upset about the service.  I have worked in the hospitality industry for years, and the places I have worked have high standards. You learn to keep tables clear of all dirty items, and you try to accomodate your guests with the things they ask for.    When she brought the bill it was $70. We still left her a $10. tip. My boyfriend wrote her a little note just explaining why it was only $10.   We eat out all the time. We are usually very generous tippers.  If the service was up to standard, and attentive as it should have been, her tip would have been double.   I am sorry Zipps. Im not super eager to return.

TUJycn6bwD2pMsnivbVoeg.text: Good place for lunch in AZ. We went on a Friday afternoon and our server was quick with the iced-tea refills and brought out our food right away. We shared  the nachos, a basket of fries and the chicken breast sandwich and they were all good. Sit out on the patio and enjoy a cold beer.

vdqDgkt4DfANw66abeR1Lg.text: It'd be nice if these cheap bastards would provide WiFi. Is it really that taxing upon you? How hard is it to set a guest network that doesn't kick you off after 2 hours while you spend $80-$100 with your girl here??? Add .05 to your beer price and make up for it if its hurting you that bad. Go to Hazelwoods across the street instead.

xs3r8f7cEpYMBq-l2c36QQ.text: Extremely disappointed.  I arrived at 11:05 pm. I was greeted by the bar tender who asked what I'd like to drink. Since I was there for just a take out order, I advised her I wanted to see a menu and would like to place an order to go. She promptly offered one, and gave me a few moments to peruse it and see what I might like. At 11:08 p.m., I place my order for wings, medium, buffalo style, to go. She keyed the information into the computer and advise me it would be a short while to wait. The place was not busy at all. The kitchen was still open. At 11:18pm, my order of wings were put in the pick up window. They were packaged in a to go box and ready for me to leave with but the socialite bartender was too busy flirting with other customers to take notice of the food which needed to be picked up. 20 more minutes went by. My food was still sitting in the window, untouched. No one from the kitchen rang a bell and identified that the food was ready. The bartender never gave me a second look because I was not ordering drinks from her. This is not the way a restaurant should be run. I understand completely the socialization which is done between a bartender and her customers. The fact that I fell through the cracks and was completely forgotten about is unacceptable.  At 11:43 p.m., with the bartenders back turned to me, I walked out. The food is probably still sitting in the hot window waiting to be picked up. I have no desire to go back for it or ever to go back to this establishment again.  Shame on you Zipps!

YJG-ng3wCFxbBDpv01kWgA.text: Look, you do not come to Zipps to fine dine. The food is average, but is great when you just want some nachos or wings. This place is for happy hour & for watching sports if you care about sports. The patio is nice too, but I avoid it since people smoke out there. blech  There's always has been room for anywhere from 5-15 of us to get a table. They are great about letting you pull tables together too. Some places are so rude about that.  It's never cramped & the place is clean. There's usually a cool mix of people in & no douchey attitude.   I must recommend a Zipparita if you've never tried one. I don't usually do a frozen margarita, but I make an exception for this one. Let's just say they put a limit on how many you can buy for a reason.  They do lose a star for not having Tito's vodka. Seriously Zipps, please fix that issue right away.   I am in here at least once every couple of weeks. If you see me, come say hi & buy me a Zipparita...and nachos and wings. Ok kidding, you only have to buy me a Zipparita. :)

b-EHtuQCwuBwmvTdfNCOIA.text: Staff was friendly and there were a few locals make room for me at the bar at an ASU game.

wXx_GZX69TbYEln6jZ4WPw.text: Dog food would taste better. Got the chicken fingers, no seasoning,  grease flavored, as was the onion rings, sent the half cooked fries back, second try was much better on frys Do not eat here would be my suggestion

V-0CgRwjB33km8Cp1RfKLw.text: We have gone to Zipps many times on Fridays after work but we are downgrading our review. The parking is impossible and it is so loud in there after a couple hours you can't even take it anymore. Very basic bar food nothing special. The other thing that is annoying is they always give us a hassle to get a table if not everyone is there when 4 of us outta 6 want drinks while the other 2 are still working.

CrknRKOl4-1h4aXBaa8aOQ.text: It's a stomping ground for sure. Love all the staff (almost) and finally fixed the Margarita machine lol.  I hate to call people out but the skinny bartender seems to hate the world, even when she was a server she always gave me a weird vibe.  She tries to flirt but then it feels like she has a knife behind her back lol. Who is she related to?  I literally feel uncomfortable when she is working, well that's my rant.  Zipps rocks! Love the dream team in Tukee and my peeps in Gilbert.

hsIPyLk_MFq7tZOzNzwcoA.text: Not sure how the doors are still even open. The service was terrible and that's being polite.  When you only have 4 customers sitting at the bar (and 3 tables)  and the drinks stay empty for 10 minutes and the bartender doesn't even inquire if we want another round....Enough said.

qwDYm7n3r1653TJTEfj-ZQ.text: Thank you zips for the amazing service! Our server was amazing. However your management is terrible. After getting our food 45 minutes after the table next to us having the exact same order, burger and wings, and us ordering before they even sat. We asked the manager to take the non consumed burger off the bill since I ate the wings and he refused to do us that small favor.  Went to the GM and he also refused to take it off the bill.  Then threatened our amazing server to pay for it out of pocket which is against the United States Dept of labor law stating that "the management must pay for it from the company and not said employee". Terrible job treating your great employees this way. Your employees deserve better leadership.

Dyvnd_M-mvEkzyTt6j076g.text: Well over half the patrons here are wearing cowboys gear. But the game with audio is the bengals vs steelers. I asked the manager if he can switch the game's audio to the cowboys and he said bengals vs steelers is the game of the week. I asked him who derermines that and he avoided my question and said we tell everyone who calls in its been bengals and steelers. Literally i dont see anyone in black n yellow or orange n black. Word of advice to mgmt: dont determine your games to be played by what espn or nfl network says. You should know your area your bar is in and know more cowboys fans are here and we want to hear that. Wise up. You go from sentimental favorite bar to TGI Fridays real quick

dvmowUaIVWDfAfoeON3JMw.text: Wings...wings...wings...the Buffalo Wings here are super good. I got the wings with extra sauce, and they were to die for. I mean I don't rave about wings that often but these were super super good. Mad Props to our server Paige for the suggestion. Ice cold 32 oz mugs of Blue Moon, got to watch the Saturday Games on plenty of TV's. Service was excellent, food was good plenty of seating and good atmosphere for a game day. Will definitely be back.

VZHdBo1EnS-3vBXSwKfPpw.text: Plenty of TVs to watch sports and plenty of parking. Food is mediocre at best. They have a decent beer list but that doesn't make up for the subpar food.

22PMfd0lC8SErSCAMSdZnQ.text: If I could I would rate it a minus 5.  We have gone in this location 4 or 5 times now and my husband orders the golden wings.  When you get the wings and celery you should get enough dressing for your meal.  They bring you a little side of Bleu cheese about the size of two thimbles.  When you ask for extra they charge 50 cents for another.  One night I ordered the chicken burrito and it comes with tortilla chips with the same size salsa.  I ordered extra salsa thinking it would be 50 cents but no.. they charged 75 cents.  So tonight we went in and brought a small amount of Bleu cheese and the manager came over and told us we can't bring that in.  Guess what !!!  We will not be back!!!!

uTiRsX7W9gsu_k0Kd3vyVg.text: Do NOT go here to watch Sports!! Went here for Fathers day with my son to watch the final nine holes of the US Open Championship. The GM Kevin Stone would not turn on the sound even though I politely asked our server twice. He didnt even come over and talk to me after I told the waitress to box everything up because I was upset. Other customers next to us were very upset as well. Absolutely horrible customer service. This is NOT a SPORTS BAR. They only play horrible 80's/90's music.

PV662sifPqWgXYvFx_zI1g.text: Service couldn't handle busy restaurant which led to my sandwich sitting under top shelf WAY to long. Soggy sandwich, I couldn't even eat it with utensils. I will NEVER go back! Service was inexcusable & food was mushy. Who the *****wants that when they spend money to go out.

kVEqpR62ICWhPvs2ofehyg.text: Hot wings! If you are looking for spicy this is the place, with fries. Monico is a great second option. Most Locations have multiple tvs so NFL Sunday easy to find the game you are looking for...minus a  not dog friendly

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 32 oz beer specials!

fi3mUVavqnHvDAc0xrvf0w.text: I actually had no idea this place was here.  We met a friend here to watch the Pats game last Sun. We were seated promptly, kinda surprised it wasnt busier.  Our waitress was great, very attentive and nice.  My husband and I both had burgers, which we enjoyed, though I wish I had opted for a single stack instead of the double that came w/ mine. He had fries, I had onion rings. I was unimpressed with those.   Overall, a good place to watch a game. Decent food, and some great specials during the week.

w8JLJG8brp_HrwURa386jw.text: Don't go here on game days. This place is woefully understaffed consistently, last visit was the worst. Waited 45 minutes for a 2 top (understandable). Waited in bar area and ordered a pint. Was told they were out of pint glasses and bartender walked away, end of story. Got to table and waited 20 minutes. No server in area, not even a "just a minute" from anyone.. Finally asked hostess if we had one. 10 minutes later, one finally showed up. If you want food, sit near the table/waiter station so that at least people are nearby to flag down, otherwise they are grabbed before getting to opposite side of restaurant. Once server finally showed up it was ok.

hP9YKyMd-gei2XVEJJXs4A.text: Well, the drink I ordered was "close" (2 count pour instead of 3) ... So, if you're looking for attention to details this is not the place for you. Service was mediocre at best. Onion rings absolutely terrible! They had the consistency of beef jerky. Management obviously not keeping anything to a high standard here. BTW, if you like fish & chips you might like the fries, but u definitely will not like the portion size of the three half sized pieces of "fish ... ?".

9QvE38dAUfnGBNkZm3lLVQ.text: You people suck, and I will ensure that our whole tennis and golf community will spread the word about how you handled the poor family that you called the police on.  SHAME ON YOU.  We will also ensure to NEVER eat at your place again.  You've lost our tennis group, golf group, Sunday football group, and many more.  You f-d up BIG TIME.

d9ljd_DCCiCS6Mo_aYLM9w.text: Wings are vinegary and came with less then normal sauce. Won't order ever again.  Was told to request saucy to avoid extra charge for more sauce...  Celery was good,  beer is lovely, staff were sweet.

B7yzZJ6HcBBt9Ud3q0xFNA.text: Their food is ok but kind of bland.  The service during my last visit was also poor. I asked for a table for 6 while waiting for the rest of my party to show up. Even though there were plenty of open tables and it was a weeknight the manager came over and kicked me out of the table saying I couldn't have a table for 6 until the rest of the people showed up.  I called the people I was meeting and told them to meet across the street at Hazelwood's instead (way better food there anyway).

e3FYG6Kla5MwSU-9ij4Jwg.text: Not my usual place but me and my college buddies went here last Sat. Place is nice and the food here is good. The atmosphere was nice too. We all enjoyed our time here. Though I'm not sure I would be back here again but if I do, I hope that its better one than before.

mbUNttRfxm9uNYTzQKosiw.text: I have been coming in here for years and have had a good experience most every time.  I was in a few weeks ago and ordered my usual salad.  Normally the order takes about 10 minutes..., its a salad.  This time it took over an hour and I still did not get the salad.  The bartender was very apologetic, gave me a beer and asked if I still wanted the salad.  I said sure, and she came back to tell me it would be another 10-15 minutes!  Not sure what happened, but a lack of kitchen management is a likely start.  The entire bar was waiting over an hour for any order, and the place was not even half full.  Needless to say, I cannot recommend this place and have found other places for my weekday luncheons.  I was offered coupons from the management, but why bother?  Overall just another sports bar with a crappy kitchen.

44L83Z3Risgdi1w2FyGU9w.text: Server was amazing but the manager Andy was HORRIBLE!! I ordered the fish and chips and about 2 hours later I became extremely sick. I let my server know and she got the manager who proceeded to tell me that all the food is fresh and up to date and that I must have gotten sick from something else-even though all I'd eaten that day was Zipps. He refused to take it off the bill and said he wasn't going to give away free food because there's no way it made me sick. He's horrible and extremely unprofessional! Never coming here again!!

U2P2Fe7NgRsR7OfHBh2acw.text: Once again I hang out in Zipps Arcadia in the same week and enjoyed another great experience. It's not by luck everyone who works here is awesome.  I would rather watch a sporting event at Zipps Arcadia than actually be at the event in person!

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Krissy and Kaylee made it magical. Thanks ladies.

aw-4cQPtgcSU6mqvH0oW9w.text: I just moved to the Arcadia area and I was so happy to have a Zipps near my house.  I moved from north Scottsdale and i have been eating wings at Zipps on Greenway for the past 10 years.  I love their crispy spicy wings and of course their death beer. Today, I went to Arcadia Zipps on Indian School and 38st and I was served with ugly looking dried wings with no hot sauce. I asked for sauce and they poured cold sauce over my already cold wings and brought them back to me in one second.  I complained and I felt very uncomfortable when all waitresses were staring at me for an obvious reason. I am sure the owner is not aware of what's going on on this venue.  Zipps is a very well known and recognized venue in Arizona.  Let's make this place more enjoyable for the Arcadia area.

o2qvuQw--ryk2SCaPhVa1A.text: The absolute worst service. I sat the bar for about 10 minutes prior to someone coming over to check on me. We have had to yell across the bar several times to gain someone's attention. Meanwhile, the bar tenders congregated at the end of the bar to chat about something and the waitresses stood at the foot of the restaurant gossiping. Our food came, nachos burnt to a crisp with nothing on them. This is absurd, we have been to the zipps in Scottsdale and Ahwatukee. Both have been positive experiences, but this is a terrible representation of their franchise. Should probably rethink their bartenders and cook....

gvQPVcqG1CjYGuWMV1x9Tw.text: Kristen is the best! I went in for a cold drink and a hot sandwich and boy oh boy did they deliver! My sever Lauren (WHO WAS ALSO FANTASTIC) went on break and I got another sever, Kristen, in the meantime.   She was so helpful. I didn't know the difference between tequila and rum so I asked her and she told me.   I got a Zipparita... whoo wee! Them are tasty and such a deal at only $4.   I was feeling tipsy but oh so good from my yummy drink so I decided to get some food.   I got pizza and fries. If nothing else Zipps should be given the Nobel Prize just for offering such a combo.   I've never really had a TRUR friend before. Someone I could lean on wen times are rough or someone to talk to when I'm having a bad day. I've never had that go-to guy who would let me cry on their shoulder. Here's hoping Zipps will fill the void!  I cannot recommend enough. This place is ideal for weddings, bachelorette parties, bat mitzvahs,   Quinceaneras, birthday parties and of course grandma and grandpas 80th wedding anniversary!   If you go to Zipps you HAVE to ask for Lauren or Kristen. If you don't, then I'm sorry to say this so frankly, but you're just being silly!!!!

ktx1027osyidr_7KncL4Sg.text: Went to Zipps tonight (11/12) to grab a quick bite and a drink. Ana was my server. She was quick and very friendly. The manager came over and asked how everything was and if I needed anything else, which I appreciated. Thanks for the good service!

0x9hA6g9156ZOFi-b4RWWw.text: Honestly, I love the bar staff and cocktail waitresses I've had here. Take your time and get to know them. This is a business of people skills. Food quality and such is never a concern here. However, I always go here for the smiles and good time. Special thanks to Crystal for taking care of my needy ass. She was both understanding and professional. Everything I would want from a manage of an issue arises. This will forever be my "go to" spot in the future if I have a little time kill. Thank you Shalomin and Angelica for the amazing service night in and night out.

yCt2IsceM89P9-kk86-RnQ.text: On Indian School and 36th st, since when it is ok for your managers to say "you are going to have to fucking wait for your food"? Waited over an hour for our food and got the order incomplete, then your manager Gary comes over and screams at us? No customer service ! The worst experience my family and I have ever had in the valley. I think even Mcdonalds have better customer service that this piece of shit place.

4hWNvozPJnmkhfiFYV8r-A.text: Let me start off this review is 110% based off service. I went to Zipps on Indian School Rd. 3 nights in a row for the Pac-12 Basketball tournament. On the 3rd night I was completely insulted by the bartender with glasses  (Aleah) who cannot properly fill a beer at a bar (I did not complain even though she filled my 32oz glass full of foam, at least 4oz worth). At the end of the night, after I had paid and was just finishing my beer, she tries to converse with me. She starts out asking me "what do I do work for?" I replied I work retail at a tactical store and that I was in the Marines for four years prior. I did not tell her I struggle with PTSD after serving two deployments as its no ones business but my own. The next things out of her mouth is... "So you get paid hourly, right?" And I replied "yes" and then she says "Oh well thats great for you because I get paid in tips." She said some other things after that but needless to say she was commenting at the tip i left her which was 20%. She then whispers to the bartender next to her (the blonde with pigtails) if her comment wasn't to abrupt and out of line as if I didn't exist. The blonde told her she was fine. Keep in mind this WAS RIGHT IN FRONT OF ME.   I have never been so disrespected by service in my life. I will never go back to Zipps on Indian School Road, and the fact that they wash glasses right in front of you at the bar is pretty disgusting as well, water did hit me in the process, but I did not complain.   Food review: For better wings I'd recommend the attic down the road (order the lousiana style) and for a better bar i'd recommend "the bar" right up the road.

8dLIyBJMM70Cd_SXG-FKSA.text: I was surprised how impressed I was with Zipps.  We came just as Happy Hour had finished (note: if you actually make it for Happy Hour, there are some AWESOME deals on food and drinks), and the place was packed out for the game.  Despite this, Zipps quickly cleared us a place at a booth and we were greeted promptly and with a smile.  Our waitress even made an attempt to continue the Happy Hour prices for us ("if Happy Hour is still going on, we actually have those drinks for $3") but I was an idiot and corrected her so we paid full price.  Dang honesty.  Anyway, the menu is standard sports fare, but instead of marking up the price to make the place seem for fancy, Zipps has kept reasonable prices for what they're selling.  One of the menus stated that Zipps doesn't believe in $12 burgers.  I don't either, so we're totally on the same page there.  I had an order of the medium wings, which were similar to those at Hooters in meat-to-sauce ratio and just as tasty.  I also tried a Zipparita, which is a delicious white frozen drink that is super cheap during Happy Hour and still surprisingly cheap during normal hours.  Very pleased by the food and service at Zipps, especially for the cost.

0FXTUOxeLaSv0meFJhsduw.text: This Zipps is horrible. I went here tonight because I was in the area and thought Zipps was a good go to. Boy, was I wrong! The food took forever. They brought out two dishes and then waited another 20 mins to bring the next one. Abigail was our server and she was nice when she came by the table. Aside from that she did next to nothing. Didn't bring enough silverware, she brought enough napkins to kill a small forest. My salad was wilted with a huge core from the head of lettuce in it. The focaccia was cold.  All in all, I won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The lettuce core in my salad!

oGC0t1sniwDcNcRl51dKKg.text: Wow, this place has really gone downhill...  I crave things from certain places after sampling the menu. Zipps has always been med gold wings extra crispy and jalapeno burger. Sometimes the focaccia.  They're sides have always sucked.  O rings and fries are disgusting. So I usually get a salad.  Last few times I've gotten wings, extra crispy (yes I know it takes 20 minutes) they were not even close to crispy, just rubbery nastiness. So I eat one or two and take them home to cook them. Additionally, the last time there was barely any sauce on them, so you have to ask for extra not a big deal but a far cry from what once was...  As for the burgers, they changed the patty a few years back and use a smaller bun . So, frankly after trying twice a year or two back I just don't order them anymore. There are far better burgers all over town.   So at this point they can't even make wings correctly which means I don't give them my money anymore.  Booooooooooo!

sQwvyQ5mRAjdHJ8t1HaPxw.text: Just stopped in for a drink after  my boyfriend had his glasses repaired. It was happy hour so there were lots of specials. We both got zipparitas, which were pretty good for a machine blended margarita, and a great price. I would definitely come back for happy hour and to try out the food. Wish there was more variety of games on.

N37Ju4Twgua73w4tM7nnWQ.text: I had a great time here. Friends and I met two doors down at dilly dally but ended up here because there were no seats at dilly dally lounge. We had fantastic service and wonderful drinks and food! So happy with our time here. We had a party of twelve and everything was perfect! Thanks Zipps!

W4GZejrhakYdJC20m657mQ.text: I'd have to say that Zipps lived up to my expectations, as I was greeted promptly and was seated to a comfy booth. It seems that every seat in the place has a view of at least a dozen screens, and whoever has the biggest party gets the BIG screen and sound...but really now, are you there to listen?  I ordered the Golden Wings, as they seemed to be one of the specialties, as are the burgers, but I was here for the wings! The lovely Miss Chelsea cautioned against going with the scorcher and suggested I get the mild sauce, but get the hot on the side. Nice move, but learned that for this gringo anyway, I survived. No problamo! Note: the side cost me $0.50.  Are you kidding me?!  I'll do it again tho, for the extra sauce was needed for these very meaty little wings that could pass for quail legs!! Got the cheese sticks for a cool down, which reminded me of eggrolls; nice change from the typical battered numbers.   Wrapping up, the lovely Miss Chelsea asked if I wanted desert. WHAT?! I couldn't resist the Brownie, but also couldn't finish it...so good! I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Utimate Brownie needed two stomachs to finish. I did my best.

aDcBIJUY5zovZJoVQFfhLQ.text: Sat at the bar and had a great experience. Server/Bartender was very knowledgable about menu and made great recommendation. Had the wings buffalo style with the Honey? sauce on the side. Wings were great! Had a great lunch.

w86tjpggF3c9xnagjrhZCg.text: Love the wings! Good nachos as well. My favorite part tho was Sam our server! She was dope. Never had to ask for anything she was on it! Great job Sam.

ZM8Qu6j-e4bSh_N7D7R3IA.text: I am addicted to their golden wings. Nothing compares. I have finally found the one and am blissfully in love. Game over.   P.S. Never leave me, I will find you.

wcYp1s01Ni8QbdcpIPrYXA.text: It's not that service is bad, servers are great, but maybe understaffed and managers are either inept or just don't care. Managers zero stars and servers 5 stars. And I guess the owners must be somewhere in between.   Been here three times and they get orders wrong every time. And it is slow. Too bad because the wings  when done properly, are on par with best I've had in town.   They need some new management to get things straightened out. I get feeling current managers don't care. But servers do. And the place had potential.

_W6INiE41L0aahnuPO0KuA.text: Went in during NCAA finals, which meant it was busy and they were short handed (what manager thinks this is good business?!!).  Food was nearing cold and onion rings were soggy! The sweet jalapeno burger wasn't anything special, it is now served on a McDonalds cheeseburger type of bun. Last time I was here it was a decent burger which merited the 8.50 price tag but now it isn't.  Won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burger is mehhh

nBbIq8jNMgjZd081fG1LmA.text: One of my favorites sports bars in Phoenix. They have lots of TVs for you to see the game(s). In my option they have the best happy hour prices and good locations

lAL5xDDXI3s4OLP4HaEx5A.text: After another attempt to enjoy warm beer mugs and gooey half cooked wings, I'm out...can't do it. Food is terrible, service is worse.   It's funny, but you would think that with food that bad, they would at least be nice about it. Felt like I was at the DMV.

g3j-lFB1Wgesd2HWMMSDLA.text: There lack of consistency bothers me... when everything is done correctly I love it but over half the time my foccacia is different. Either no meat in the end pieces, chewy chicken (sometimes tastes microwaved) or bad service. The appetizer should be served before the entree!   When they're on they are one of my favorite spots but I now second guess going more often than not because I never know which Zipps is gonna show up.

i9sEIOkd5T85yz92lLJ74A.text: EAT onion rings!!!!!  OK there are other things that make this a great bar but they have all been said. Friendly staff great food and cold beer. But seriously ONION  RINGS!!

eva2KHpLP_o_HDMoR1nuig.text: The golden wings are amazing here and you can't beat the price of a zipparita at happy hour

WoEAXH4C8GBWJOoR66PALw.text: I've always loved wings so when I heard zipps had the best wings in town I had to check it out. Originally went to a different location but I'm glad I ended up here. They have THE best customer service here! the staff is always great. Especially Alicia G! She's amazing. Such a sweetheart! Definitely check it out! BEST ZIPPS IN TOWN! :D!!!

YtH8Ofh7eUo1O5OrfYZeXA.text: Why is every Zipps different in the way they make their food? I get it, you want to be unique but you're a chain! New fries. Please. Pretty please. And all locations need to carry the sourdough bread. Again please. The service is the only thing that excels across the board with all locations. Kudos to that.

iGSVYxeeJ2O49Y2xMz2PDg.text: This place is really great but unfortunately it's so large and so big that service can sometimes be slow it's also very loud and noisy that's great if you love sports and don't mind the loud noise and crowds I will say they have a great outdoor patio with a fire pit and there was lots of parking.

Hj1bopa9k-0swwJqAvmDXA.text: I normally LOVE Zipps! We always goto the one off 40th/Indian School & Bethany/16th St..great food and drinks. We went to Zipps on Thurs night off Indian/40th St & it was very HOT inside, which was very disappointing. We even moved from the bar thinking it was because it was by the door, we moved to hight more central & it was still very hot. TURN ON YOUR AC! We rushed out as soon as drinks/food was done,  think we'll be going back to the 16th St location from now on .. .

fqXQHflEBvHaPyIvOcwp1Q.text: everytime we have been there (4).. either the food was bad or the beer is flat! this last time (11/29/2014).. we ordered a pitcher of premium beer (dos seces) it was flat and tasted bad, our server outside said sorry and thats all? so much for customer service ..cya

WlRrVAgbd9jnC0ECLo3uNQ.text: i'm giving them the benefit of the doubt with 3 stars because our experience was really one 1 star worthy. but i will say the food itself was good and the waitress that ended up taking care of us later did all she could to make up for it. here's what happened... myself and a group of about 7 or 8 friends called ahead to see if we could save a table for the usa vs portugal soccer game. 4 of us arrived early to save two high-tops in the bar. they wouldn't let us pull them together until everyone had arrived, which i didn't really understand, considering it didn't take up any more room and we had to sit 2 and 2 to save them until everyone else joined us. the restaurant and bar was already filling up, but mind you, this is a sports bar, and not the first usa game, so one would imagine they would be fully staffed for an event like this. the four of us ordered food and a couple beer pitchers. the first pitcher came out quickly, but after that it all went downhill. 3 of us got our meals, the 4th never got hers the entire night, and it did end up on the bill. now, like i said, the food was good. we split nachos and i got a bbq chicken chopped salad. i feel like on a dead night, the food would be enough to make this a good review. as the rest of our group arrived, the bar continued to fall deeper into the weeds. there was only one bartender behind the bar, which of course made drink service even slower, causing the waitresses to fall behind. this, i don't blame our waitress for at all. but when something is causing your customers to be unhappy, it is your job as the waitress to make it right, even if it's not your fault. we saw our waitress a total of about 4 times all night. another waitress stepped up and ended up taking care of us pretty much the entire time. our drink orders continued to be messed up or missing throughout the night. several of us at the table were or had been servers, so i think we were probably even more understanding than most costumers. we still felt compelled to at least point out to them that at one point, we were only waiting for 2 pitchers of beer, and had been waiting, with all empty cups on the table, for 40 minutes. finally, we asked for the check. about 5 or 6 items showed up that we had either been cancelled because one of our friends had to leave early and never got her order, or we never got. again, like i said, the waitress that ended up taking care of us was super understanding, took everything we told her that we never got off of our bills, and did apologize. i would go back here if i knew it wasn't going to be busy, hoping not to get our original waitress. i would never go back during a big sporting event though, as i don't feel they prepared for it or did anything to try to make up for it (ie. manager coming to apologize, offering to comp something for us).

sQGGofWThBQhrbgRN2IpCA.text: Their burgers are great and they have the best frozen margaritas around.  However, on my last visit, I thought I'd venture out a little and get a Tuna Melt. OMG! It was horrid.  Some gooey, mayo soup stuff over a toasted piece of bread which was not the type of bread I asked for.  Our server was slow and overwhelmed but in no time, we could see she was new and clearly had not bee fully trained.  I could not blame her, only her management.

mCullQeSknjzcJgt0UowPA.text: UGH. That pretty much sums my latest zipps experience. Which stinks because we used to frequent the one in north scottsdale NIGHTLY years ago before the kiddos came :) We were looking for a quick bite to eat at the start of a date night, and my husband suggested zipps so he could watch a game. Hot wings? Don't have to ask me twice.  It was rockin, but we got seated pretty quickly. Our server was nice, but horrible. I used to be a server, so I have much higher patience than my husband. (Who started to resemble Wolverine when the server didn't show up before happy hour ended so we could order more beers) Our food took forever to come out. Again, I'm not nitpicky.  We ordered onion rings (they were actually cold, and tasted stale. How can something fried go so horribly wrong?) and wings ( THANKFULLY those were as awesome as i remember). I was still hungry, so I got a basic burger. EEW. It tasted like JackintheCrack. you know the spongy tasteless meat? that's what I got. and without the toppings I ordered it with. Nothing makes me more grumpy than bad food that doesn't even have the mustard/mayo you ordered on it!  Only good thing here was the wings. Don't go here for food. Drinks/t.v.s ONLY

1BO5rqoZCPCFnhpG2Oi8PQ.text: Staff is excellent but something happened to the wings.  I ordered my usual - hot and x-tra crispy and the wings were pretty nasty this time around.  They were the type of jumbo wings that I have never had before at zipps and they were anything but xtra crispy - skin was rubbery and well, blech.  I was totally disappointed and I don't know if I will be able to order them again.  I have had them numerous times before and they were really good, not today though.

AuPFn0Mg_mLsIYdsUt7rMw.text: Beer is always the coldest! I come here for lunch a few times a month and never really had a bad experience.

LhKpkBt7B5_UJ1ZdaM1CqA.text: i wish i can give it a 5 star food was great service was horrible  we waited for about 30min and still noone came to see if we were ordering anything to eat till finally i asked a young lady wearing black to help us she was not even our waitress so i recommend  great customer service brings back the customer in the other hand i will continue  going to scottsdale.

uVUjpGH8QkiB-ON6buu87g.text: Came here to enjoy drinks and food... Nope ! Shit came out fucked up mayonnaise was so nasty it had to be at least 2 months expired!! So gross. Server was super nice and apologetic, manager had no nerve to talk w us.. Won't be back.

jRt8aM4kLJBfjOfJHcts4w.text: I was there about a year ago watching football with my girlfriend. It was so loud in there we could not even hear our conversation. The place was short staffed and took a long time to get our order. When it came out it was cold so we had to send it back to be reheated. Our waitress did try her best but was overwhelmed. Its fine when it is not busy there but when it is crowded I do not recommend it.

ZxAdb3pttsvVkUlISj_keg.text: I have been to other  Zipps,  and even this one, before and the food and service have been great, which would be why we went there again today. BIG change!  The restaurant might have had 8 tables busy at the lunch hour.  The waiters was very nice but service from the kitchen was really slow.  We ordered the burger with a chili and pepper jack cheese, a basket of fries and sweet potato chips, and a BLT. We both ordered Ice tea.  We sent the ice tea back because it tasted as it if it had been filtered through a mold screen. I commented that the ice tea  container might not have been cleaned recently. I got water and my friend ordered a Coke. I got my water but the Coke arrived as a sprite. That is a waitress issue.  My burger tasted as it was not fully cooked but on checking it seemed to be properly cooked. I kept eating it but kept thinking this might be a bad idea.   My friend sent the french fries back because they were just barely cooked. I tried one and sure enough, almost raw potato. The sweet potato chips on the other had were cooked to death.  It is now 30 minutes late and I am pretty sure that burger is coming back up shortly. When I sensed that "just a little off" taste I  should have refused to eat it.  The waiters took the fries basket and the tea off the bill so she was trying. Mixing  up Coke with Sprite and then ignoring us was a mistake that got noticed in the tip.

EE9o8P23awkhSRQHg4C6MQ.text: Sat at the bar service was prompt food was alright the fries are no good the chicken tenders have a lot of breading kinda weird but the chicken skewers Were tasty.

xy6qKsA6I27y21U83NyDAA.text: I am a long-time customer here, one of my favorite sports bars in my local area. I feel bad not putting a review the last few times that I've been here, those should all be nothing but good reviews. This last time unfortunately was the worst ever. I'm thinking it may be because the employees were new but the owner I'm sure as hell would like to know how some of his employees work while he's not around. Been here so many times with the family but this time around we just weren't treated the same. I ordered wings was charged full price during happy hour and received 8 weeks. I asked when they change that, the waitress didn't say nothing and said I'll be right back. Long story short, came back and said I have two more Wings on the way. My son asked for a refill and the waitress said okay honey hang on just a second I will be right back. And she forgot. My son got his drink about 12 minutes later. I got my wings, two wings 10 minutes later. The way they apologized was not accepted wasn't even a real apology. They brought the two wings and said enjoy your wings. I asked for the tab and I, basically excluded the charge for the wings and only paid for wut we ate and drank. I forgot to exclude the extra Ranch that I ordered LOL. Anyway, we won't be back during the week. Horrible feeling after going thru all that and my son asking about his drink.

C_r7g9Jb6R6YzEuZiqHF9A.text: I've been to Zipps multiple times and I just experienced the absolute worst service. We will never go to this restaurant again. Our orders were almost completely wrong with one 1 of the 6 being correct. We had to ask for silverware as well as glasses of water. In addition to the incorrect food, the waitress did not check to see how the food came out. After our meal, we asked to speak to the manager and had to continue to wait. After explaining the experience to the manager, he was useless and did nothing for the poor service that was provided.   Super disappointing since we used to love coming here for happy hour and now the service is horrible.

jmPKxzZT9GDPz7i-aUh94A.text: We started our night out at this place to grab some pizza. It is next to Dilly Dally, which is an awesome Dive bar you should check out!   We grabbed some pizza and sat outside by the fire, there was plenty of room and it was not crowded at all. They also have really good drink prices, we got $11 64 oz pitchers of CoorsLight.   We played some pool while we drank our beer and waitress was extremely nice. We will be for sure be coming to this Zipps again to start our Friday/Saturday nights when we go out to the Arcadia area again.

nW_ZNqxAJy0khlU8U21h2Q.text: Love this place.! Honey Basalmic Salad with Chicken, YUM! I started coming here with my husband for a quick lunch, he really likes the wings Golden Medium Spicey, they are good. I decided to try out a salad. I have been back weekly for the Honey Basalmic Salad. It is so crisp and fresh and I get grilled chicken on top. We always sit at the bar for lunch so service is quick. It is so good I brought my mom a couple weeks ago. Now she thinks about that salad. Just make sure you order dressing on the side as it can easily be overwhelmed.

vuPixF-lshmIuczhII2J_g.text: Service was 5 star. Food was awesome. My order was one order of wings,chicken skewers 1 burger and 2 basket of fries.But seriously waited over an hour for 1 burger and 2 baskets of fries.I get that they were busy. But if you can't  handle the pressure of working in a high pace restaurant then you need to find another job. The people in kitchen need to get with the program!!!! Kitchen employees are making The waiters/waitress look bad!!! Our waitress was awesome and was on top of everything. But because of the kitchen detail. I will not be returning to this location!!!!!

a891vPPnz7aWgRK0Ebglsw.text: When you're forcing your fingers to tap away at words you wouldn't normally put into a sentence. At least not for this ish'. Zipps is supposed to be that neighborhood spot that's not trashy, but not fancy either. I have mad faith in this spot because it's been pretty good to me. However, like a relationship, the bs starts to get old. Does Zipps not have a standard recipe for all dishes? I mean, it's very common to order something and have it presented differently almost every time. Let's not include the basic appetizers (which come out f'd up too sometimes). I'm more so talking about: salads-from the different mixed greens, to presentation, to burgers, the list goes on There is no standardized process or expectation. Is everyone back there free styling making "their" version of what Zipps food and menu should be? Or did I not get the memo? People want consistency!!! You raised your prices- now raise your standards.  Dissatisfied person- 32-36th St Indianschool location

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. O yeah, I requested another drink. Which unfortunately never/hasn&#39;t came. This place used to be my fave, what is going on?
Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. If you want some undercooked, raw chicken, then order their chicken skewers. I tried giving these a chance....again.

DU8vJjOe-w95WqRMynYDKA.text: The roaches in this place are sooo gross! Our table of three turned into a table of five. The manager said they just had their ANNUAL roach spraying and "it causes the roaches to be more active". "Annual spraying" and "more active", I asked? She then said quarterly spraying. Wait, what?? If you have roaches and know about it, don't you think you would aggressively treat the problem until it was corrected? Not Zipps. This is a picture of what is crawling around in their dimly lite restaurant. Wings anyone? YUCK! To be fair, the restaurant manager gave us $10 off our bill and killed one of the roaches.  I keep trying to give this place a chance to improve but I have officially given up.

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roaches on wall while we ate @ Zipps Indian School rd

ZwxdzpAOXHWl113zA_6XfQ.text: I went in last Saturday night with my friend Sherry for a quick bite and drink. It wasn't that busy, maybe 15 to 20 people total in the whole restaurant. We ordered two orders of buffalo wings one beer and one order of fries. We were waiting about 10 minutes to receive the beer and had to walk up to the bartender to ask them to have it brought out. We got the wings no problem. We still had not gotten our fries half way through the wings. We kept trying to hunt down the waitress but she never came back to check on us once. I finally had to get up and find a random server to ask about  our fries which were clearly forgotten then a third waiter brought them out to us not even our waitress and the fries were cold. Really poor form on the waitresses part for disappearing. A very simple order that was completely botched up I will not be coming back

5O2OYQo3BRSGduS1Xfz5SA.text: Zipp's Arcadia was one of my favorite local "go to" sports bars in the neighborhood. Anyone that knows Arcadia, knows, there are some other pretty cool spots, but I always appreciate the personable service I get from the bartenders and barmaids. Anna and Rachel are a couple of my favorites! They are both great at what they do and make it cool and fun. Frankly, they rock!   The food is pretty good, but the level of service is what had me coming back. You also get to know a few of the neighborhood regulars and feel like a neighborhood family, hanging out to watch a good game. Thank you to those that have made it enjoyable, up until today!! I appreciate you! Cheers to you!   My complaint is with the Manger, Kevin! The bar was empty, which I could see is his biggest concern. The place was not packed by any means and no one was standing up waiting to get a seat. There were empty tables behind me. I came in crutches today to watch the SEA vs ARI game and he insisted, that I remove my post surgery boot, off the chair next to me, so that the seat would be available to someone else. There was no one else. I attempted to tell him, if the seat was needed, I would gladly put my foot down, if someone needed to sit down. Regardless, of logic and good manners, he insisted I put my foot down. So, I gracefully put it down, watched a great win and paid my bill. I doubled my tip, just so that I wouldn't take away from the level of service and commitment that Anna offers. I wanted to make that clear, despite his lack of leadership and consideration.   However, I will not be going back, ever! (YES, I WILL BE PUTTING MY FOOT DOWN, Kevin!) I hv lived in the Arcadia neighborhood for years and appreciate a good local bar, but Kevin made Zipp's the opposite of what I thought Arcadia was known for and took pride in.   Kevin, find another job! You are not good at what you do and after sharing my disappointment with other patrons and staff, I am not alone in my opinion. For all those that can't or don't say it - You suck at your job! My suggestion is to go back to school and learn some management skills or supersize my fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheers to Zipp&#39;s Arcadia!

XPFhYP13bvQmQGRp5P1YrQ.text: As always the service is so fantastic! Ashlee and Amber behind the bar are seriously fantastic! They always know what my friends and I like they also are really good at remembering what the ZIPPS vibe is all about!!  We recently had Bobby as our waitress and she was awesome too! It's hard to find a server like that! ZIPPS has a new menu and some really yummy stuff on it! I'd recommend this location!

-mq2FA8O6yhMnwq045oa4Q.text: Hands down the best grilled wings in the valley. Just be sure to ask for them to toss em in the sauce before throwing them on the grill. They will take a little longer to make (17 minutes they say) but those char marks are well worth the wait!  Unfortunately I can only give three stars being some servers will try and dissuade you from ordering the wings grilled because they need to flip the tables quicker and maximize tips. I understand money is important but after ordering grilled wings at this location for the past 8 years I've come to expect a little more respect.

cfF6shP7JOyvjy4sEYtJWw.text: We love this place! Never disappoints, our favorite waitress Mariah is amazing!!! Food and atmosphere never fail!!

G2fjMjdnlKMCvYzuuZ9Ckg.text: BAD UPDATE:  I decided to give this place one more try for take-out last night (10/19/2015).  Thought I might be safe with some chicken tacos, sans Sour Cream.  This was the driest, most disgusting meat I have encountered in my LIFE!  My friend thought they accidentally gave me beef!  (There is a choice between mix 'n' match beef and/or chicken.)  I actually thought she was right until I could kind of tell the difference.....  This is a dry, goopy mess with no salt, no taste, no moisture.  The "soft corn" tortillas fell apart IMMEDIATELY upon order and I was around the corner after picking up.  Zipps all over town have been awesome - I DO NOT say this about all.  But something about his 36th St. and Indian School location (called chefs, service, QUALITY CONTROL, MANAGEMENT, and more) is seriously troubling.  Love all other locations.  If this is in fact a chain, this particular restaurant is highly misrepresenting quality and brand equity....

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. THE most disgusting, dry, flavorless CHICKEN (?!?!?) tacos I&#39;ve ever seen....

01N16GwVws9AF1esChcA6w.text: Food and staff are typically pretty good at this location but, as regulars, we have certainly had some servers with "off" nights. Try to avoid sitting in the booths unless you are okay with feeling the people behind you every time they shift. Decent happy hour specials.  I am really not that old, but sometimes the music is just too damn loud!! :)

NyDvhsNjcOcK60e8f_VQ6w.text: Best Zipp's location, I swear. Terrific service, corn dogs with a homemade feel, atmosphere that is low key yet high energy. Fries and onion rings are delightfully crispy.

INH1RhFfd_ikBI36rcXfJA.text: I order a slice of pizza with 3 toppings and it comes out cold and with the toppings dumped on top. The cheese is paper thin and the crust is like cardboard. Little Cesar's would be better. I tell the bartender and she replied "I will let them know" and that helps me how? I know it's a sports bar chain and I don't expect amazing food , but have a little self respect. Don't spend your hard earned here. Avoid it like the plague (although you may catch it here) .

8fK9erXz4vBXegc0zWdchw.text: This review is for Bobby! We come here frequently for the food and cheap drinks but FOR THE FIRST TIME EVER... we received quick and personable service. Bobby was on it. If she is working.... request her. If you are a hiring manager and you are looking for someone in customer service... recruit Bobby. If you are Bobby's Manager.... I hope you are keeping this woman actively engaged and taking care of her because SHE IS AWESOME.

7jo_s-k58wGW92zYmPIQeA.text: So I just got off the phone with Tiffany at their corporate offices and I am sorry to say that she was not willing to address the public humiliation that we endured at this location. They stand by their employees and apparently think it's okay for them to disrespect people in this manner. I called with the intention of addressing the matter of public humiliation and how Jared spoke to us and I kept getting the response that they provided a convenience to us for providing separate checks. So basically, telling people that they are immoral and irresponsible are part of their employee training program.  She also continued to state that my friends and I are "attacking" them on social media. Wow, doesn't feel too great. Her "apology" was "I am sorry for your frustration, but we stand by their employees."  I am absolutely beside myself with this company and how they have reused to have their employee apologize for his behavior. So when you visit this location, please keep track of what you ordered, how you pay, and when they pick up your payment. It's clearly your responsibility to make sure they are doing their job. Oh, and if you're in the mood for a loud verbal attack with a side of humiliation and a splash of racism, please go here now!   If I could give a negative zero, I would! We just left this establishment and are mortified! We went to celebrate my brother in laws birthday and there were some people there that we didn't know. Some people ordered shots, my husband and I and another couple did not order shots! Well, most of the group left and we were the 4 that stayed. Jared, who I think needs to glorify his ego every now and then basically harassed us into paying the bill for 3 shots that people (who we didn't know) didn't pay for. He referred to us as irresponsible customers. When we asked for our bill, he tacked on the 3 shots we did not order. We told him we would pay for the food and drinks that WE ordered and he told us we had to. Jared spent taxpayers' money by calling the police. We happily paid our bill for the food and drinks we orderedh, (which is a solution we offered to Jared) and the police had to mediate because I'm sure they have nothing else to do on a Saturday night. So now, for paying for what we ordered. We are now considered trespassers at Zipp's. Jared, much luck to you in life. I truly hope that your career at Zipp's flourishes. #dreambigJared

2HlZEnM4Qp0zHX5_CD_7hw.text: 7/15/17 What started as a celebration ended in horror. Everything ran smoothly until the checks arrived and we noticed 3 additional shots that we did not order and when we tried to rectify the situation and have them removed from the bill the so called manager by the name of "Jared" or "Garrett" refused to take them off because individuals who were in the group (that had left at least twenty minutes prior) had left them unpaid. He informed us that we would now be responsible for paying for their error and lack of organization. Keep in mind the waitress broke down separate checks and the group had paid their tabs with no trouble or issues. We asked for our check and he proceeded to add the unpaid shots to our tab which led to a humiliating ordeal as he called the cops (great use of our taxpayer dollars) because we refused to pay for something we didn't order. Great customer service! The sad thing is I've been going to this location for 5+ years and never had an issue. It's amazing how the management has deteriorated and become incompetent. Lesson to be learned is if you refuse to pay for something you DID NOT order you will get 86'd. Save yourself the heartache and go somewhere else.

yS0mS3zhDcVfwRfz-8vIpQ.text: I've been a frequent patron to this Zipps for years. They must be under new management because the experience is completely different.

RiMz3Vh_l86XeLPmhGBlCQ.text: Great food, TVs everywhere, service is alright. Overall a good place to watch a game and eat some bar grub.

7zivOTtSzBurvDIqcAXLaw.text: This place has a really great happy hour!  I love it- the food is good and the beers are large.  Amen.

qQWGnGsvtcL_n3cOQZ_6ug.text: I have to say I think Zipp's has got it dialed in.  I have never made Zipp's a destination place but now with more of them through out the Valley I find that there is one in my daily path more often than ever.  I usually find myself at the Indian School one where the bartenders are always fantastic and they know what type of experience I need at the time.  I have never had a bad meal, with my favorite being the addictive Manaco Foccacia Sandwich.  Zipp's is emerging or has emerged as the most solid and consistent sports bar and grill in town.

v8n04JvkwG_36RJ36M9Z9Q.text: I came in with two friends to watch the Brazil and Ivory Coast game and was happy that they had the audio on for that match as well.  I got my usual hot wings which are really hot but very flavorful.  The match was good there were fans for both nations there which was nice it would've been a bit better if Ivory would've made it more competitive but whatever that's why it's a game.

jLNfs3GhvQw6mfRrU5Ngyg.text: When you get the right server, this place is the perfect trifecta...  Service, food, and atmosphere.  Food is better than typical bar food, but not fancy.  They have enough tv's in the place that you can watch every game without being taken over by them.  Golden wings are great.  Monaco Foccacia is my personal favorite. Kids always enjoy their dinner with mom and dad, maybe because of the chocolate chip cookie skillet with ice cream.  Good food, great service, perfect prices.

yzy3E3zkdsjIsQjMV6b8qg.text: Excellent spot for grub and watching a game.  I was impressed with the service and that will keep me going here instead of Hazelwoods.

KzcpPqL9n_MzhCLnvNx-Kw.text: Zipps is basically my home away from home and I wouldn't have it any other way. I've only been to the locations in Scottsdale but decided to try the new one on Indian School after work for the Suns game. It was packed for the game and luckily we got a table on the patio. We had decent service probably would have been better if the Suns weren't in the playoffs. They had a good happy hour with cheap beer and apps. I had the chicken quisadillas they were spicy and delicious. The only thing that would have made it better was if the suns had won.

wPWufaPkcFApP7EJVHZfjQ.text: excellent, fast service even when its totally packed!  we always know we will be treated right here.  addendum: love the onion rings and food in general -- but vegetable pizza toppings (like onions and green peppers) are typically not fresh and are sprinkled over reheated cheese pizza slices. dont order that unless u were aiming for frozen pizza taste.

LZR57FCqyK5tjtYoc8E0uA.text: Went in after being opened a couple of months. What a tragedy, such potential. Worst food I've had at a sports grill... And that's saying a lot!

7pdSfJVNA6zakn3IsiMqlg.text: Liked the place, nice cozy little sports bar.  Food was great and overwhelming.  Barmaid was nice to chat with.  Place is well run.  Prices were cheap and reasonable.  May be good place for dinner too (went during lunch time.)  Easy to find, was in a shopping center.

R0aixiaGfBFQRp2CpKt3bg.text: So busy tonight there was standing room only! And the NFL game wasn't even AZ .  Place seemed fun. Staff looked busy but calm. I'll try ya again but arrive earlier, i don't care to stand.

Wc0G7e6wsB0IKBpTEGzG1Q.text: This a good solid bar...they have a wonderful priced happy hour and food!  The scene is fine...they have all major games and sporting events on the big screens...they have good bar food!  The patio is huge and its nice because you do not feel like you are on top of people...the bar gets a little crowded but I would not expect anything less of a sports bar...the staff is fine...I was not displeased but I wasnt overly impressed...they were solid...It is in a great location and have plenty of parking...I will be back!

CGWQfZYyHAEe1MWBcI3ASg.text: After all of Condor's world travel, you would know that I have a working knowledge of the World Cup. So while looking for the perfect spot to watch Brazil v. Ivory Coast, I stumbled into Zipps on Indian School.   First, a little disclosure. I own 3 gold mines in Ivory Coast, so I am biased. Second, I am glad I am not at the game, because from the consistent buzzing noise, there must be a swarm of locust hovering around the stadium.   Bottom Line: Best Burgers in town, hottest athletic looking waitresses, cold beer and knowledgeable sports fans watching dozens of High Def TVs. Only drawback, not a lot of sympathetic Ivory Coast Fans.

heDoNuJaF-96YTPyqx5teA.text: Below Average  We started out by ordering chips & salsa. They apparently forgot we ordered them.  After waiting for 15 minutes we finally saw the waitress again so I could ask about them, at which point she brought them right out with an excuse about being slammed. There were only a few other tables occupied. At least the chips were pretty good. I think the salsa was Pace.   The grilled chicken sandwich was nothing special. The chicken was thin and dry. The onion was sliced way too thick so it was a bit over powering.   My wife tried the pizza, which was equally unimpressive. It seemed equivalent to cheap frozen pizza. My two year old wouldn't even eat it.   The french fries were devoid of taste and needed some seasoning. Perhaps they could have sprinkled them with some Viagra, because they were also rather limp.  The only good thing was the price. You get what you pay for.

znMDa1oorkuzpcAY2lJ1Zw.text: If you are looking for a good sports bar then call off your search you have found your new favorite spot. Plenty of TV's, pool table, shuffleboard, good drinks and decent bar food. You won't go wrong checking the game out here.

rv0nKa3SQw8aeSWueKBSRw.text: This is still my favourite Zipps even though the new one on Bethany is closer. Walk into this Zipps any time and you instantly feel welcomed and comfortable, is it me or is the one on Bethany sort of douchebaggy? Anyway, they have awesome specials during their Happy Hour- especially love that the specials are different every night of the week. Must try the Zipparitas! I'm glad they only serve you 3, trust me, its plenty! Also can't go wrong with the buffalo wings or skewers, or the $1.50 slices of pizza. Oh, Zipps, you complete me! I choo-choo-choose you.

pjqt4JdZS1ny398oLy3MMQ.text: I ordered a Chicken Focaccia and got a Chicken Wrap with a side of attitude.  Glad to see another sports bar by work so my coworkers and I headed there for lunch. The place was busy, as it was the lunch hour and it looked like the TV section at Best Buy.   I asked our server if she wouldn't mind having our orders on separate checks.   Her response: "I'm not obligated to do it so if I have time, I'll do it."  What I wanted to say to her: "Bitch, please!"  I ordered a Chicken Focaccia and when I got my order, it was a wrap. Since all my coworkers started eating and she was no where in sight, I just ate it. When she came around, I asked her if this was supposed to be a sandwich:  Her response: Well, this is our version of focaccia. The wrap is like a thin pita bread quesadilla thing. Its not focaccia. Its our version. I thought you knew because you come here all the time. Well... do you like it?  Firstly, this was my first time but I must look like I eat here all the time.  What I wanted to say to her: "Bitch, please!"  The wrap was basically chicken chunks, mayonnaise and a pita bread quesadilla thing. Whatever that means. It was gross.   If I wasn't there with a bunch of other people, I probably would have sent it back but we were all on our lunch break together. For my first visit, you get one star for poor service and not knowing what focaccia is.

uw2ueS2j_94nOYTAcrPPhg.text: Good place to watch sports and have a beer and a burger.  Nothing extremely special about this place, but good nonetheless.

2DOeL6IyXMm_S7X8XRng1Q.text: I ordered shrimps with fries. Shrimps and fries are edible. The server was nice she took our orders but never came back to refills our drinks. I have to asked some other worker for our check. The music was very loud, the place was weird looking especially the ceiling. They need to work on their shrimps and fries.

pyTtu-qbyjB6VbwvynmzIw.text: I recommend the golden medium wings, saucy, & extra crispy. They may take a hot minute to come out, but that's because they are made fresh and not pre cooked, they are definitely worth the wait! Cheers!

d_Tkp7-QC7dTASigFktO7g.text: Great spot.  Zipps is pretty good all over.  I'm glad they came to the neighborhood.  Hazelwood's has probably the worst service I've encountered in a sports bar.  Zipps always has great service and good drink specials.  Good place to be even when it was 110 degrees in there for the ASU-Georgia game earlier this year.  Food is always good with a great selection.  Go here, try to avoid the place across the street.  Addendum for Fred M: Phoenix is not a basketball city.  Phoenix has never been a basketball city.  Phoenix is not a sports city.  Phoenix sports fans have never been fans of anything.  Finally, paid shuffleboard is an ugly reality now.  It is more and more difficult to find bars without the paid shuffleboard.  Unfortunately, it seems that many places want to fleece us for some more money on top of the cold ones we paid for during play.  I love shuffleboard and I think that everyone should have a table in their home.

2LVRhqBHfHp2faQ0BJekdQ.text: St. Patty's day and totally dead in here which is why we stopped by. Figured it would be easy to grab a quick bite and a green beer. We were so totally wrong! T42lnkIT2_GxR3v_iSXONw.text: Great drinks and surprisingly affordable. My girlfriend loved her salad. My hamburger took 45 minutes on a not so busy night but was delicious. The fries I couldn't eat. They were hard and looked old

uEhNwiJ9whCQ1n5DByx7dg.text: I've been to a few other Zipp's in the valley, from Peoria to Scottsdale. Each has a different personality. I prefer the Indian School location because of the historic charm of the older building which this Zipp's occupies. And I've been to this location before, for lunch with my "foodie" co-workers.  Zipp's shares a lot with your typical sports bar with lots of televisions. Big televisions! But the exposed barrel vault wooden trusses and red brick make it feel more welcoming. It's like the difference between watching a baseball game at a stadium built in the 70's vs watching one at the friendly confines of Wrigley Field.  There are a lot of options on the menu which you might expect from a sports bar. And then there are some that are a step above. There are plenty of salad options and healthier choices as well. I have yet to try a pizza yet, but my co-workers can attest to their goodness.  The burger options are pretty unique too. During this visit, I enjoyed a green chile burger with pepper jack cheese and a small side of chili. It wasn't pretty, but it was an excellent combination of flavors! I only regret not trying the home made sweet potato chips.  Other Zipp's locations are flashier and newer. Which is fine. I prefer a little more character in a sports bar. Due to this being a lunch time visit, I neglected to pay attention to the beer menu. But as I recall from my Peoria visit, there was a solid selection of beers available on draft.  And if you've ever tried the infamous Cheesy Burger, it is not on the menu, but it's still available by request!

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Green Chile Burger... With Chili!

QsDBb9z3tPjzFt8JeW-5iA.text: Zipps is close to my house - so naturally it's my go-to during football season. The food is decent and the servers are attentive. I always get the buffalo wings. Not the best I've had, but pretty good as far as a sports bar is concerned.  As regulars during the football season, we typically try to get there early. They won't sit you at the big tables until your whole group is there. This can be frustrating when you're waiting for one person, but you have to be sitting in a corner with a bad view of your game.  Overall, Zipps is what you expect from a sports bar.

kLHvoluABXOSJxCMPDoAfg.text: Let me start by saying the service was exceptional.  Our server made sure we had plenty of beer and checked back frequently.  That was the high point of our meal.  Next, we had the wings, regular, hot.  Others have raved about these wings and I would have to say that for bar food, they were not bad.  The wings were meaty and slathered nicely with a hot sauce that was actually hot.  Unfortunately, however, it went downhill from here.  Everybody at the table had a salad, Buffalo Chicken, the chop salad, and I had the Taco Salad with Ground Beef.  My salad was described as having fresh jalapenos and salsa.  It probably would have brought some life to a sad, uninspiring salad if those two ingredients had actually attended.  It had high hopes, but failed miserably at delivering anything that would have a spark.  The lettuce was put in the bowl wet, which left a pool of water at the bottom, after being tossed in my (requested) blue cheese dressing.  The dressing just kinda combined with the water to make a watery, limp mess of the lettuce.  The ground beef did not taste fresh, nor did it really taste of much anything.  The cheddar cheese was buried somewhere in the lettuce.  My companions had similar comments about their salads.  It is too bad, as it looked like they were trying, sort of, to meet the menu description halfway.  Too bad, as it really sounds good from the menu.  A decent selection of beers, both domestic and foreign, with a couple of mass-marketed micro-brews for diversity.   The bar itself is mostly dining room with tables and some booths, and I did see a nice patio with a firepit and televisions, but it was too cold for us to sit out there, a decision apparently everybody else made.  I was also informed that it was a smoking patio.  Oh well.  There were big screen TV's mounted everywhere and they all had the same game playing (Rose Bowl), so you could only miss a play if you blinked.  There is one lonely pool table that sat unused for the time we were there, and a couple of golfing video games which seemed just a bit more popular.  A shuffleboard table went unused as well.  Prices are a bit on the high end, considering the product that was delivered, and while they brag something about "no $12 burgers", I suspect that even paying $9 might be a bit extravagant.

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. What better way to enjoy a Rose Bowl game, than a basket of wings washed down with a pitcher of Dos Equis?

u3yGiWYFg4GJpGUirr6B-Q.text: Zipps is a staple for any sports season. Their prices are ultra competitive and they recently expanded their menu. The Golden Focaccia has been an excellent addition to the Focaccia arsenal.   If you're ever looking for a good happy hour after work or a place to catch a game over the weekend, Zipps is your place.   Keep up the great work!
