Another amazing food place.. bad customer service!

h_pZMImIiPVu_EGK3GFoJA.text: By far the worst place near me. Unless you enjoy eating carelessly prepared food, being lied to, being overcharged for things that are supposed to be on happy hour or have items added on your bill (in the hope you won't notice), don't go here. Since this place opened up,  I have been probably a dozen times.  Each time I have been it is one ridiculous thing after the other.  One time I ordered a buffalo focaccia and it came with no sauce! It was plain chicken wrapped in  damn bread...so of course the server told me they served the sauce on the side now...my husband ordered the same thing on the next visit and it came with the sauce in the wrap! And figuring out their happy hour makes you just want to grab a 6 pack and head home and even if you understand between what hours to order what you have to correct them because it is NEVER right. This weekend was the last time I will ever step foot in this piece of sh* place.  My husband asked the server if Alaskan Amber was on special,  she said yes and when the bill arrived SURPRISE! We were charged full price.  She then gave us some BS about it being super premium which wasn't on special.  The manager offered to buy him a beer NEXT time...no voucher to prove he offered it...because of course he can be trusted! So no, I do not recommend this place. Yelp should allow you to give negative stars...

AeXJGPvROpq1P1HdnFTTcg.text: TERRIBLE SERVICE. Every. Single. Time. I know that sounds like an exaggeration but it's totally True. Every time I'm here the service is painfully slow (and daft). Food is always cold as they let it sit in the window. They always put tabs together even when there are clearly 5 or 6 different parties. What?! Why would you do that?! Computers exist to make your lives easier - use them!

UYuPkyKSTY5aYhH-SKm9Ow.text: I eat at Zipps on a regular basis and it's a good place to take kids because it's loud and no one can hear the kids if they get loud or out of control. The wings at Zipps in my opinion are the best in town. If anyone thinks different send me a message and let me know because i am always looking for great chicken wings.  Overall the food is good, great kids menu, and great happy hour. Service is what you would expect at a sports bar, not bad but not great. A definite must try.

BKeiuj2OdK2xW2yQ9_g--g.text: I love Zipps! I have been going to Zipps for years mainly to watch sports on one of the many televisions they have playing or for their amazing wings and Happy Hour. The wings are better grilled too so try them that way!

BWv5PkFEWxHIwpxTSu6Fjw.text: We went to Zipps to watch college football. The Kansas State alumni club was taking up much of the restaurant with the KSU/OU game on the tv's. The service was very good as the waitresses kept up with everone. The food is conventional bar food with a limited beer selection. Prices weren't cheap but given than we camped at the table for three hours, it was fine. Probably a 3 star sports bar experience.  So I rate my Zipps experience 4 stars because of the entertainment value provided by the table next to us. It had about six of the most annoying teenage boys I've seen since my daughter's 8th grade advancement ceremony. Now, granted, I came from a generation where you bent the bill of your baseball cap and hid your smile if you were 15 and rocking braces but I'm no square. I get that teenager boys are constantly trying to figure out the society around them so I cut them slack for dressing like retards, growing too slow, and being annoying - in fact, I even pump up my Zipps Yelp review because no one responded when, for example, the table of virgins cheered when OU scored in an attempt to rile up the KSU alums. And to watch them putting away ranch like it's nobody's business while commenting on who should ask out the waitress (she was probably too hot for me, but why wouldn't Angus have a shot at this 32 year old POA? What with his off-color Red Sox cap and sweatshirt from the Jesse Pinkman season one collection, who could say no?). From watching them systematically remove any traces of vegetables from their Cheapest-Thing-On-The-Menu-Burgers to discussing the merits and shortcomings of the domestic swills (Ham claimed a liking for dark microbrews -- but then failed to make a "just like I like my women" joke) to stumbling through dividing the check with proper tip, the fact that Zipps leaves these wieners alone and treats them like a regular group of awkward grown men will assure their (and my) repeat business as a new generation of ASU-educated 49ers fans are bred right before my eyes.

dbyPvZ0FHWNpG9Ps4rqtQg.text: I headed over to Zipps yesterday to watch the Heritage Classic with some fellow hockey loving Canucks. The bar was extremely accommodating and put the game on the large central tvs with the sound on. Considering that there were only six of us, this was extremely generous. I suppose that it helped that the manager was an ex-hockey player from Boston.  The happy hour specials were great and their wings are indeed tasty.  Don't believe the hype though, they're not "way hotter than anyone else's, honey".

5MD11-q75AyYnQJ5wNLk2g.text: This place has only been open for about 3 weeks and I've already been here 4 times.  I've lived down the street from Hazelwoods for over a year and have also been there about 4 times. As you can see, I've decided on my walking-distance sports bar of choice.  They have a great, cheap happy hour that lasts until SEVEN. Which means I will never again risk death on the I-17 as I race home from work praying that I get to the Vig before 5:55 so I have enough time to order a drink and some hummus before prices go back up at 6:00. Instead, I will leisurely cruise on down to Zipps. Maybe I'll even stop at home first to change, something I would never even DREAM of when Vig was involved.  Zipp's freed me from the hell that is 4-6 Mon-Fri happy hour.  The $3 margaritas taste very much like the $6 Z Tejas 6th Street Margaritas. There's a limit of 3. I'm not sure if that's for cost control or safety liability, but 3 is enough to knock me on my ass, so I won't complain. The Golden Hot wings are amazing, and surprisingly hot. I would start with Golden Medium and then get a side of Hot if you think you can handle at. FYI: It makes people perspire.  I've yet to have an actual meal here, just apps and drinks, but the menu items look tasty (I'm especially looking forward to trying the Sweet Jalapeno Burger) and if the execution is on par with the mouthgasm that is the wings, I'm sure I'll be satisfied.

z84VY1m1257kBlcilEk5Pg.text: Let me know when you people fix the goddamn air-conditioning, and I'll *consider* coming back for a second try.   It is an outrage that you dared to open this in August/September, knew there was an a/c problem (as evidenced by the comments of your staff when some in our party complained), and have still done nothing about it as of late September. Absolutely infuriating to walk into a place on a 100-degree night only to find it feeling like 105 inside. I should've listened to the game on the radio in my car. When the waitress asked if there was anything else she could get for us, I almost said "Yeah, a shower."

GWr7_WQStpAx7obb3iR-xw.text: This rating should really be a 3.5, but Yelp doesn't have that option yet!! Ambience and service: 4 Food: 3  I rounded up because the service exceeded my expectations in every way. Very attentive, friendly waitress. The manager checked back several times, refilling beverages and striking up conversation--all very friendly and welcoming. Drinks were always full and I never had to ask for anything--very impressive, especially for a sports bar.   Unfortunately the food is good, but not great. I ordered a slice of happy hour pizza ($1.50 plus .50 each additional topping) which was quite good and I'm a pizza snob. I highly recommend the shrimp skewers off the appetizer menu--delicious! But they come on a bed of way-too-greasy and overfried onion rings. The fish and chips were also very greasy, with thin, unsatisfying fries. I guess this is what one should expect at a sports bar, but I'm a dreamer who keeps hoping that someone will get inspired and offer the best of both worlds.

e7n_4SA0AesYY5122a1tZg.text: Zipps is my favorite sports bar and grill in town.  Food, drinks and service are great!  Happy hour specials offer reduced prices on some menu items.  Ambience of this location is warm and inviting.  I especially love their medium golden wings and cookie skillets.  It is a great place to meet friends and watch games on many large TV monitors.

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Ju03d8Ah0cN26Rieb50_Tw.text: I cannot speak to the food at Zipp's as I have never been there, but I can tell you that they went out of their way to help me do something special for my Bestie on his birthday.    I live out of town and was not able to be there for his party, so I thought perhaps I'd have cupcakes sent.  They let me know that they don't usually let in outside food and drink, but that they were happy to make an exception.  In fact, they called me several times to follow up and make sure that they had all of the details down so that the treats got to the right birthday boy.  Mark and Chris were awesome and totally went above and beyond.    From what I hear the food is pretty fabulous there, too.  And I can assure you you'll get awesome service from their wonderful staff.

EicfaGX_izE6qzUtQmTzig.text: Wings, Beers, Burgers, Football - Sunday Funday never tasted or sounded so good!  Zipps knows it - Zipps as a restaurant/bar knows how to appeal to its customers.  Unfortunately I was unimpressed by this particular location.  Nestled in a strip mall across from another sports bar, Hazelwoods, I just didn't get a good vibe from this place.  Although relatively new, everything seemed old.  The lighting was dim, and the atmosphere was dark.  It felt like it needed a remodel.   I am a big fan of both North Scottsdale Zipps locations so maybe I'm just spoiled, but I don't think I will be returning to Arcadia.  It does keep to the standard Zipps format - Flat screen TV's all around, drink and food specials throughout the day.  But like all of the locations - it gets crowded and sometimes the layout isn't the best - especially when you're trying to watch a particular team.    The food here was good - but it's always good.  Standard sports bar food - wings, burgers, fries, with hearty portions.  Beer selection is nothing special - mainly domestics and no IPA's (which in actuality is probably better on Sunday football days so you last through all of the games!)  I do enjoy their bloody mary's.  Service is as prompt as it can be with as crowded as it gets.  All in all, everything you want and expect a Zipps to be - just in a subpar location.

-lhim_uSYgCBXiW5w7ZIBQ.text: Not a bad for a bar in a strip mall. Tons of tvs and plenty of seating. Typical bar food. Service was attentive. Overall a good spot to kick back and have a cocktail and take in a game. Will be back for football!

X_UXDQE_9gAG8UP5-IbfPA.text: I'm a fan of the Zipps on Greenway so, naturally, I'm a fan of this location automatically. The golden wings are so bomb dot com that we visited Zipps 3 times in one weekend when our friends were in town. They loved them just as much as we do. Plus, it's a great place to hang out and grab some drinks. Throw some shuffleboard in there and you're good to go. The night we went to this particular location we had great service and she was pleasant throughout despite our table growing in size with each new friend that arrived. Sorry sweetie...but thanks for keeping up! Great place for a casual dinner and grabbing drinks. Don't forget their awesome late night happy hour!

JBm_78vch178xcbTBO79VA.text: I am so happy this place just opened! Chances are if you're a fan of great sports bars you've been to one of their other locations, but this new location on Indian School is one to go out of the way for.  After entering, I first noticed that they did some great remodeling, knocking down all the walls and really opening the place up to show off the almost infinite amount of flat panel hi-def tv's. The hosts were comically over-inviting, and I'm pretty sure I heard 5 or 6 enthusiastic "HELLO!"'s, but that's the least of my worries when I enter an establishment. After being led to the booth (yes they were PACKED, but there's booths lining every wall) It must've taken 30 minutes to read through all the specials, and I believe there's only ONE HOUR THROUGHOUT THE ENTIRE DAY WHEN THERE ARE NO SPECIALS!   We ended up ordering better than average chips and fresh guac and the best wings (golden) I'd had in a while, and that's when I saw it... Four massive flat panel hi-def tv's set on TRANSFORMING ROBOTIC ARMS THAT PERIODICALLY SHIFT THEM FROM ONE MASSIVE TV STRUCTURE (showing one channel) TO FOUR SEPARATE TV's (with four different channels)!! I don't know who thought of that, or if it was an original idea, but it was a really cool touch.   Our servers were so nice and attentive, the food was fresh and generously portioned, and the overall experience was perfect.  It was great to get the same great things I had expected from Zipps...

S1ZNUGY14XB28Af-wa8yoA.text: I stopped by at around 8:30 on Wednesday and I was shocked to see the place nearly packed.. On a weeknight! I could have sworn it was a Friday evening. I enjoyed the happy hour menu, the music selection, and the energetic staff. Zipps is a lively place to go, where it's hard not to have a good time.

xyyMlub5h36KmzI75QfLEA.text: Friends, Coworkers, and acquaintances have been hyping up Zipps to me for years. The wings, the burgers, the shuffleboard, the tv's, and well just about everything about the place has been hyped to the point that I was dying to go there when I found out they opened one across the street from my favorite sports bar, Hazelwoods.   The beginning of our visit didn't start out so well, when we asked for sound on the Suns game and heard the response "we only do sound for big games or if people request it." Firstly, it's a big game anytime the home team is playing. Maybe you're new to Phoenix, Mr. Manager of a Sports Bar, but you need to figure out that Phoenix has always been a basketball city. Also, the sound has been requested, we are requesting it, and I was told when I called at 4:30 PM  that sound on the game would be no problem. I told the manager about my previous phone call and he didn't seem to care. 15 minutes later he came by and said "ok, some people requested sound so we are going to turn it on." damn, was it that hard?  Food came, and I ordered the golden medium wings I'd heard so much about. Hmm, these wings were neither meaty, crispy, or quality. They sure were tasty, but the quality was not there. I had the Wednesday special of four chicken tacos, and they were also of low quality. I know this is a sports bar and I don't expect tremendous cuisine, but c'mon, don't insult me with this garbage. I'd have been better suited eating chicken mcnuggets from McDonald's. I was in for $40 having three beers, tacos, and wings. I couldn't have been more unimpressed. I've spent half the money at Hazelwoods and Native New Yorker and been twice as happy.  Now this was a kicker that may not be big to anyone but I thought it was pathetic. Their shuffleboard table has bars on it that prohibit anyone from playing unless you put money in it. I've NEVER seen a bar which doesn't allow you to play complimentary or even just hold your keys like Pomeroy's or 16th Street Sports Bar. Ridiculous. Lame. Awful. Also, their TV setup was not what I expected. I don't think there was anything bigger than about 50" and with how high on the walls they were, they were kind of difficult to see from certain places.  No sir, I don't like it.

SzZfWBUK2AVU4nAGtYRJxA.text: I was there with a group of 20 people for hour happy, it was packed at 5pm when I arrived. I sat with my group. It took over 10 mins before I could get our server's attention. After that, every time I needed a refill or anything I need to wait to get her attention. It was a great place to hang out with friends, but not impressed by the service.

GI0IGinmW_xNQZWeiV52TQ.text: Pierre, perhaps you should find a bar more...ahem...suitable to your taste.  Sometimes when you open a new bar, you're going to have glitches.  And being rude to the server will not earn you any respect in the service industry...my guess is that you have never been there.  This Zipps is fluid, well run, inviting, and the servers were ALL friendly to my friends and I during happy hour.  The drinks are delicious and the food is well prepared.    For a sports bar...fantastic.  For dinner, fantastic.  For lunch when I only have 30 minutes and I ask the bartender if she wouldn't mind asking for a rush....amazing.  Thanks, Zipps...for continuing the tradition.  Let's leave the annoying ones at home, where they can properly shower without company in whatever temperature they choose.

DgCGX5uNs9qW7u6WxwcVjg.text: I always come here for the wings. They are good every single time. They are my guilty pleasure indeed. I get them with a side of fries and a salad so I feel good about myself! Haha. Check this place out when you're in AZ!

MyaXwpRobxjRflUIGi7How.text: Went here for happy hour wings and drinks wings nice and crispy while still juicy honey golden hot and a cider  8 bucks for 10 wings drinks were on special too def will be back good place to come with a group

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

DhQ9HC_vN3Qmxx46ydJCiw.text: If you want greasy bar food that is bomb, this is the place for you. They run amazing specials every day of the week. The zipparita is a must try! They have sooo many flavors to choose from, I always have a hard time deciding what to get. This is the place to go for a splurge on comfort food. I soo love their burgers, one of my favorites. Onion rings are hot and made to order.

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Watermelon and raspberry zipparita

1sopnzYOjkZZyYajNy3qxQ.text: Great service.  We had beer cheese bite pretzels and 4 slices of pizza, very good. They have small TVs in each booth...

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. TV in the booth
Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pretzel beer bites

Huvm6gGWRjNZE-_1j-zJCQ.text: First time here and George was by far the best ! He took the time to get to know us and did a great job with our orders . We would return for him ! George saved the day my hubby was missing his second patty and the manager right away said it wasn't listed right in front us instead of just trying to make it better ! But George took care of us !  5 stars for George 0 for the manager!!

fBxfhuOkel8tECVHVJcDjg.text: Went here on a Sunday night and it was pretty quiet. Our waitress, Denielle, got our drinks immediately and did a fantastic job at making sure we had everything we needed. I had the strawberry zipparita from there and it was delicious! Their wings are probably the best thing on their menu. I had been to some of their other locations but this one is definitely the best of the chain.

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Strawberry Zipparita!
Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Zipps chicken fingers tossed in buffalo medium sauce!

eWUdzBSkG0VO0YeJuaVjAQ.text: Pros: Good TVs for watching sports, good beer specials   Cons: Food takes forever to come out, one order came out wrong, one order simply didn't come out, some food was cold, servers are spread thin resulting in poor service, food quality was pretty poor  Conclusion: I may go back to have a beer and watch a game, but never for a meal

BM1h7FBXVg7jJCj7OMCfHA.text: Wonderful food. Great atmosphere. Wonderful waitresss Except one who is a bit condescending and rude. Other than that. Great place!

tO3c9luNHH-AlMvua_NVcA.text: This is normally out go to spot after work on Friday's. Never have any complaints but this time around, things were terrible. The drinks and food were great when our waiter finally came around with them. Had to shout to get his attention and was very rude and always in a rush to go to his other tables. Who were also getting terrible servIce. Think his name was John, forgot to look at the receipt when I left because i was in a hurry to just get out of there. So we went over the bar side and were going to stay for a couple drinks but sat there for about 7 minutes without anyone greeting us. So we finished the last sips of our drinks and left. Will be going the extra couple miles to the other location.

RtjN7XrFBgVQBeuU_pfT_w.text: One thing I can say about Zipps, regardless of location, is that it is an incredibly consistent experience.  The wings they offer are really good, some of the best I've had in the valley. The service is hit or miss at every location I've been to, especially this location (my preferred) in Arcadia.  One thing about this location is that it has a ton of seating, has a ton of TVs and isn't a bad place to chill while watching some sports and drinking some beers.  If you want decent food and decent service with prices that won't break the bank, come to Zipps.

K_bGaAvYSuvDyJ6D51Kj9Q.text: Man no. This place has the worst food. Don't go here. I dare you to go order the mozzarella sticks. I dare you. Tell me what they are because it doesn't look or taste like cheese. You've been warned.

GsJ_paqjIGxHSq1PNpCl2A.text: Haven't been for awhile but some things don't change:  food ok, beer cold & still a pretty good venue to watch sports...

m9Cac3Fk7PKYwxBrUSmtOg.text: I stopped here to order lunch to go.  The bartender greeted me and asked what she could get me.  I said I wanted to order some food to go.  She said "Ok, I will be back in a minute to take your order."  It would have helped to have a menu to look at while she was gone.  She came aback and asked what I wanted.  Hmm. What would you say?  I asked for a menu.  I ordered a soda which she put in a to-go cup. Awesome!  Wish she would have refilled it while I was waiting.  I left when they gave me my bag of food.  When I got back to work, which is 3 minutes away,  I opened the box to find brown cold fries and a dry as could be chicken sandwhich.  I doubt I'll order from here again.

zbo_Zo26lxrVxqbhgkPYWA.text: Cold beer, tasty chicken wings, complimented with good buffalo sauce! Strong need to work on server etiquette, must improve service level. Had probably one of the worst service experiences at a sports bar/restaurant. Watched a whole football game with our server only coming over one time to check on us besides bringing us the tab! :(

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

8lChFYFhCCM1AdJu0woZsA.text: As I don't do yelp reviews very often bare with me guys! Currently still sitting at Zipps on 36th street and just overwhelmed with the amazing service here! I've been to multiple Zipps before across Arizona and have never been as impressed as I am today. Our server is just fantastic, super cheery and outgoing, as every server should be. Every person that has walked by is cheery and obviously happy to be here/working here and I just can't get over the all over fantastic vibe of this place. I worked in the industry for five years and know the difference between a team that flows and works well together/gets along and let me tell you this place is one of those places! So impressed!!! Thank you to everyone at this location

BZiFuvaGmOTn-C6hBwFhZQ.text: Service is good, but consistency with the food is spotty. Just a couple weeks ago I waited 45 minutes for a grilled chicken sandwich and the bartender argued with me that it takes longer to make a grilled chicken sandwich than a breaded one ... once I finally got the sandwich it was gristley.   I do love the wings here and the burgers and they are always on point. All the girls that wait on you in the dining area are always friendly and very professional.

VRyRupOPFvJByAI0PbOoYw.text: The food was good but the french fries were a pile of greasy crumbs, I'm not sure how the kitchen allowed them to be served.   The most disappointing part was the confusion that came with our beer order. Our server told us our beers would be $6 each but when we received our tab, we were charged $11.25 for our beers. When we asked the waitress to reconcile the difference, she told us that they would not honor the originally quoted $6 price for the beers.  The manager on duty's name was Gary. Gary didn't even have the decency to come to our table and apologize for the misunderstanding or offer to discount our bill. This will be the last time that myself or my friends will dine at this Zipps again.

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JICDobAAh-RxmJ3N198Zcw.text: We ordered wings, chicken skewers, and a basket of fries/onion rings.  When our food came, the wings and chicken skewers were hot.  The basket of fries and onion rings were just lukewarm.  I told the server that they were not hot and she took them back and said she would see what she could do.  Less than 5 minutes, she brings another basket back.  I tried a french fry and it was lukewarm and soggy.  I got the server's attention and told her the fries were not hot and they were soggy.  She took them back.  Bobby, the manager, came over and told us that they are taking the fries off our bill as the fries can not meet our standards. We told him they were not hot and they were soggy. He said he had already made two baskets of fries and did not want to make a third.   He did not make us a new 2nd basket as there was not enough time between the server taking the first basket and the arrival of the second basket.   That was it.  No apologies and no offer to get us anything else.  We were left there with no fries and onion rings.  Unbelievable!!!  Extremely poor customer service.  I won't go back there!

kInOeW7SdTpKUqK9C-KaPw.text: Come here all the time never had a bad experience. Brought my family to show them how good it is. Walked in and the sign said seat yourself so we sat down at a booth against the wall. Waited 10 minutes  and no one came to the table. No big deal went to the host stand and got menus. 4 servers made eye contact with our table multiple times no greet. We left and went somewhere else. I'll come back and sit at the bar but I felt bad for my family.

dfWZo_76eDZMTX9u2WlFRA.text: Zipps used to be a great place for wings, but not so much any more!! The service was very slow, the food took a long time and wasn't very good. Won't be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yucky burned onion rings!!

Iccs3DumlK_CtKjrp9K6mw.text: We love Zipps green chile burgers and golden wings. Came here to use a certificate they gave us last time we were here and they messed up our order. Apparently they don't know the meaning of a medium (not medium well or well done) burger. So we gave it another try. Burger was still not cooked correctly and the sides were from the previous day. We asked for new and the manager said they're cooked in the morning and all of them were soggy so he offered fries instead. Still soggy. Still sucked. Not coming back.

y1OhBuFufBXgc5InWCEp4A.text: Went to Zipps to see 2nd half of game of Cardinals...beers were cold, servers were ok, but I did notice that the Mercury team WAS NOT listed on the walls.  The Championship team not there? They lost this customer...

W5SP8Bi_dSU42jN4brcx2A.text: Went here last night for some food after work with a work friend. We had a really good time! Lots of big, flat screen TV's with all the games on, great drink specials and good food so far! I had a grilled chicken sandwich with fresh cut fries and homemade ranch...YUM. Friend had fish tacos and she raved about them. Will definitely go back! Great find!

rYVw9TLq8bSmMa7Okie7gQ.text: Plenty of TVs and a great burger deal on the weekends, which, coincidentally works REALLY well when you're looking for cheap eats while game watching! Know that you'll be getting 2 patties on the specialty burgers which are the ones on sale.

ggdwClcQiVAbj-HwqyxGng.text: I used to love this Zipps and when it grand opened next to my house I was so excited to finally have a Zipps so close by me! I have gone there so many time over the past few year and other Zipps in the valley. The waitress know me by first name and they have always been great until recently. They have changed management and most recent manager doesn't know how to maintain cliental. This is the reason I rather drive and go to other Zipps where they appreciate a regular! I recommend going to angrier Zipps in the valley! I love Zipps and their food, but other Zippa treat you well and actually attend to your table!

NaNJNGUjfYD80A9xOLiuUQ.text: I love Zipps! It is my favorite neighborhood bar/hang out. Zipparitas are amazing, and dangerous! You are only allowed 3, and 3 is all you will need.   They have a great happy hour. In fact, there is only 1 hour per night they do NOT have happy hour (7 -8 pm). The specials change every day, but they often have $5 wings (Golden Medium are the best in town), $3 zipparitas, and $4 32oz beers. The service is always friendly and casual.   Finally, it is a great place to watch sports, and everyone knows it. If you go on a Sunday or during a big playoff game (college, NBA, MLB, etc) it will be packed! Get there early for a decent table.

R43Gl8-AoclXJamrqN8Ijw.text: Excellent bar food.  The burgers are so totally greasy and flavorful!  The beer battered onion rings are worth waiting for.  The service rocks at this location and we are happy with both food and service every single time we go.  Can get very loud on the weekends, but HEY, it's a sports bar!  Nice flatscreen televisions located throughout.  Bathroom is always clean.  Yup, I'll be back!

-RNGI3GEJbfu1lKUrq5J4Q.text: Best wings on this planet every time I am in Phoenix I stop here. Had the best service today from the sweetest waitress I don't  remember her name but she was on it. I also had the best titos and soda perfect made drink. Keep up the good work. See you when I'm back in town.

lvDUIeqMSWwrGX-x8VPzTw.text: Great place to go watch a game. They have a huge fireplace on the patio surrounded by big comfy chairs. The food is pretty good. I wouldn't say great, but I've never left disappointed. Typical sports bar menu. Pizza, wings, sandwiches. Try a zipparita....not sure which flavor it is but it's the one that has the pink on top.

NDDZG-_4SHK87Crr7kdW1Q.text: The wings were cooked perfectly! Very crispy skin but juicy and lots of meat on the inside. I had the Hot which were delicious. I honestly thought they were not hot enough but the flavor was probably the best Ive ever had and I eat hot wings every where I go. The atmosphere was great, lots of big TVs playing sports. Once all the live sports were over they had a very good choice of classic rock playing with espn, espn news etc on the TVs. I didnt have the pizza or burgers but those next to me did and it looked really good too! I would deffinately recommend this place for some great good, cold drinks, friendly service, and great atmosphere!

lVPr_rSN2LDa_TlopsB7Gg.text: Lots of fellow ASU fans in the house and some delightful chicken wraps.. awesome place to meet up w/ friends..

dnHajN4BMYXNNLa888FZew.text: I've been a fan of Zipp's for years. I appreciate it for what it is. Good pub food, cold beer and games on the tube. Not bad.  I've enjoyed most of the focaccias I've tried but typically get the chicken with an extra side of the garlic mayo. Burgers are good. Wings are good. Fries and onion rings are great. And love the cookie skillet.  So I was quite surprised yesterday when we found ourselves with some time to kill nearby and our Zipp's Arcadia experience was completely underwhelming.  Beer was still cold but the chicken focaccia was flavorless, as seemed even the garlic mayo??? And the fries and onion rings were limp lukewarm. It even seemed that the beer batter was way off with a chalky touch.   While I don't have high expectations for Zipp's, nothing crazy, I was still completely let down. Though I expect to spend a great deal of time this coming year right next door, I will take the extra time to choose and travel to a better nearby spot. I'm sure I'll give this location another chance in the future but not for a good while. Disappointed.

zxDTJO0NjEZZRPKd5SXmFw.text: What can I say? I love Zipp's! Stumbled upon this place one night, and right when we walked in it just had a nice comfortable feel to it. It was a monday night, so the wings were on special as well as 32oz domestic drafts, which was music to my ears bc i'm a huge fan of wings! Not domestics though... My fiance ordered a burger which looked really good... but I'm here to talk about the wings! I ordered the Extra Hot because I think I'm a badass with an iron stomach. The waitress warned me that they were stupid hot, so I opted with just Hot... they were also stupid hot... I can handle my hot sauce but this was straight habanero! Good flavor though! Now any time I go I just order the Medium with the hot sauce on the side for LIGHT dipping.  Like I said before, this bar is just very cozy. The patio especially! The armchairs surrounding the fire pit are comfortable enough to fall asleep in. There are flatscreens everywhere (this is a sports bar after all)!   The bartenders and servers are all SUPER friendly, and I'm pretty sure the one who warned me against the Extra Hot wings probably saved my life by changing my mind! Thanks Zipps!!

vsUfNEMupUvCcoXggCz4GQ.text: The food and drinks were good BUT our service was terrible. I am not, and never have been, a picky person. I also realized we had a larger group (8-10). So I even was giving them the benefit of the doubt but our server hardly ever checked on us. I waited lengthy periods of time before I even got a chance to talk to her at which point she would listen to half my order and run off only to be gone for another 10-15 minutes before I ever saw her again. Our orders were generally wrong if we were lucky enough to get our orders at all. Half of us had to order multiple times before the servers even got the order into the kitchen. Once the check came it was incredibly wrong. The servers seemed very inattentive and unhappy to even be there. It seemed like a hassle to even speak to us.

DuHkgNTZVk0I3vg36suguQ.text: So my initial review was 5- Stars, but after my last 2 experiences in the dining room area, i have dropped them to 4-stars. On my last experience We waited 30min for food that was never put in, then ordered something else, only to find that it was going to take longer than expected.. Was there for an hour and only had a beer. Usually this place is great, but sometimes inconsistent with the wait staff in the dining area. I will stick to the bar area from now on.

nbuk9AboD7OFoDkP7d8GyQ.text: Worst place ever to watch a game. Audio up audio down audio up audio down the entire game. Who ever complains the loudest gets their way with game sound. Until the next person complains. Food average.

SmLh2o5W1OpmWaP2zW0M3g.text: Great place for big beers and good times!

QJfuM525915bz7vlMrb5zg.text: I don't know what it is, but I have NEVER been a huge fan of Zipps. Everyone chats up the food, but I feel it's very basic.  The only reason why I continue to go back is because the wait staff are typically really nice and wonderful, as well as attentive.  Customer service goes VERY far with me.  If their staff wasn't as good, they'd get a one and I'd never go back. I wish I understood why people loved the food (I've had burgers, wings, etc) but I will come back for the service alone.

RJRRmkx3qPaY9JTc9CooZQ.text: This Zipps in Arcadia is a smaller, older version of the Zipps in chandler. I'm grateful they have one here, though, because they serve up nice, cold 32oz'ers for a very good price (not the norm in Arcadia for draft beer). The food is pretty good and the service is great! I would def recommend this place to anyone seeking a kickback atmosphere to enjoy sports, drinks, or just good company.

YhZZ7GTFrtYwlRrVs9CuKQ.text: We came here while visiting town for the Fiesta Bowl and heard it was the Kansas State alumni hangout. It was mostly empty when we came in, but I imagine it's a fairly lively place during sporting events. They have a decent selection of beer here, including some microbrews. The tables are mostly sort of temporary foldout tables and stuff, and the whole place feels sort of dank, which is okay for the type of place it is. The menu is nothing special; normal sports bar burgers and things. The loaded nachos were very good though, which I took as a good sign and bumped this place from 2 stars to 3.

Y60omLkpmxesbUkdWd78hQ.text: I don't know why we keep giving this place another chance. I think we want it to be the place we once knew and loved. The servers are consistently good but the food quality consistently plummets. We absolutely will not be going back! Even the chips are nasty and that's really hard to do.

9bzttejPE0Sw0bh8sIyUIg.text: What kind of bar that calls themselves a "sports grill" won't put on the sound for a playoff NBA game and instead opts for horrible pop music because "the majority of the place isn't watching the game." change your name Zipps "pop music" grill. Smh.

flMjVyf6LO-5xbhGmfPkqw.text: KInda petty, but so is Zipps in charging me 50 cents for an extra small cup of dressing. The salad is pretty big to begin with and you only get a small cup of dressing. I ran out halfway through and big dude with beard gives me the extra cup, but doesn't mention it will cost me extra. Yeah, I know it's 50 cents, but its salad dressing and it's principle. Stop the nickle and diming Zipps - don't worry your cost of the dressing got deducted from the tip. We always have a way to get revenge baby!

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $10 plus $2 on Saturday

Qq7AvjisvCoXz4aYQD_GMA.text: We have been here multiple times for happy hour. We enjoy the location but never our servers. Typically, we get the same girl. She has blonde hair and black dyed underneath. Her name has never really stuck. However, we come in a group of only about 6-8 people and it is always an issue to split our checks. She claims it is because of Zipps management, however, this is a stupid response. I have never heard of an establishment that won't split checks for a party. This sever also took about 20 minutes to bring waters and confuses cokes with coffee. She also brought out drinks we never ordered but of course, have to pay for. She also checked our IDs, naturally, but if she was truly paying attention, she would know it was someone's birthday at the table and would have mentioned something. Her complete lack of common sense lead us to question our happy hour locations.

2YFocRTvFioUnjXMNXJ2oQ.text: This use to be my favorite sports bar. Unfortunately, the food the service and pricing all suck.. They nickel and dime you for everything extra sauce extra ranch for $1.50 they will split a meal for you??? The wings use to rock now they are average at best. They usually don't have enough sauce and are undercooked. The service is a joke the services is slow sometimes rude and managers are worthless. Avoid this Zipps

VkC4jw3S9N3mPKuUn0CSOg.text: I would give this place zeros stars if they would let me! The service is usually terribly SLOW, and tonight they never made our take out order...after an hour of waiting I asked for my money back. I agree with Rachel S., not sure how the doors are still open!

a3g0azmy_BpY6lX8RElG5A.text: Sort all these comments by date and read them.  To put it simply, ownership does not care.  They're making money hand over fist at other locations and have let this place slide into a crevice deep into the earth.  If they gave a damn about the customer, and customer service in general, these comments would stop flowing.  This could be "the" sports bar to go in Arcadia with minimal effort.  As a (former) long time regular, most of the comments you read here are spot on and the norm these days.  Slowly but surely they're losing the core of their business, their regular customers.  Goldman Group:  The authors of these comments aren't bitter former employees with a grudge.  These were your loyal customers.  Start listening.  They're doing you a favor by giving you feedback.  PROS * A history of solid staff behind the bar for the most part. * Outstanding technology (I.e. number of TV screens, screen placement, etc.). * NFL Sunday Ticket and individual TV's labeled with what game will be shown on that screen. * Beers specials and beer portion size. * Decent, but shrinking, group of regular customers.  CONS * High floor staff turnover. * Store Management does not know sports.  Setting the TV's for current and appropriate sports content should be a basic fundamental, ya know, for a "sports bar."  Game sound for appropriate games should trump their weak Muzak selection.  Katy Perry anyone? * Food quality has consistently declined over time.  Forget about ordering their specialty, wings, well done or crispy.  They won't be cooked to order.  ALWAYS check your to-go order before you leave the bar.  It's often wrong. * Bathrooms are not well kept. * Nickle and dimed for extra anything. * Seat comfort at the bar high top tables. * Management.  The decent managers have been transferred to other stores or have apparently left for greener pastures. Current store management doesn't have a common sense clue about service.  In a nutshell Zipps Ownership, customers want a reason to come to this location.  They really do.  It's conveniently located and could be a sports bar with a great vibe.  We've given you chance after chance and you consistently fail and disappoint.  If you're not going to listen and improve, close the place down and let someone take the space who knows what they are doing and gives a damn.

o4xLIuWRZSi_i30xW7D1zg.text: Great for watching football or happy hour with coworkers. Was a little crowded but still got good service. The golden medium wings are where its at.

9Eg4gBITPs-ij41qj3kOsw.text: My wife and i always stop in when there's a game I want to watch. Her favorite is the turkey chili, which is meaty and quite good. I usually get a burger which if you're craving a greasy burger hits the spot. The pizookie (cookie with ice cream) is unnecessary but always delicious and appreciated. I'm sure I'll get "dragged" there again soon by the MRS. (I go willingly).

HMkBN61gh_lEqbPVf4ha5A.text: First time at this Zipps. Not that busy. Sat at the bar for a couple of minutes before a manager came behind the bar to ask us if we'd been waited on. Mind you, there was a bartender who walked by us several times without  acknowledging us. If you are or aren't busy, just say hello and "I'll be right with you." Simple tips for customer service in the hospitality industry.

AoumZWnZEP_l5XcihHUVAg.text: I love this bar and go on a regular basis! Love the food, atmosphere, great specials, but definitely the awesome personalized service!! I have been there recently and it seems like it has new management and the feel of a local bar is not really there. I feel like I'm being treated more like a "customer" than a local friendly bar!! Management has to get more "adaptive" or let the service be!

xb9x9PHGxG0Ts-ad5-jtlg.text: I like to take ownership of the bar I go to. I like to feel as though when I walk in, I am at home with a bunch of friends. Rarely do I feel out of place after a couple visits somewhere.........I unfortunately feel that way at Zipps from time to time. I will cover that in a bit..  ~Fud/Drink~ The food is OK. I expect a bar these days to have better food if you are paying the prices they put on the menu. As much as people knocked my old bar that closed, Antars, the food there was amazing, and there are many other spots with better food options than just burgers. Here, its generic bar food. The salads are all iceberg lettuce with some generic romaine thrown in. I can go to a bowling alley and eat the same quality of food. The sandwiches taste good but aren't made with quality add-ins. Prices are still high, and I have to be careful or I'll be spending too much. There aren't many high incentive deals for me on Sundays for specials, most of them are during the week. Oh well.    ~Atmosphere/Service~ Jumping to the level of service, let me give you an example of what I recently ran into: I had to go outside during that recent cold spell we had in early January 2013.  It was close to 25 out, I had my Jersey on expecting to sit somewhere inside but, due to their expected large rush of customers and the bar being filled, they awkwardly advised me they couldn't let me sit at a table normally for two...Even after I insisted I could wait until a seat opens up at the bar. Instead they had to have me go outside. I didn't bring my coat in, because I was expecting to show off the jersey...that's why you bought it in the first place, lol... Now, given this scenario, I will point out the heaters were on, but its just too damn cold. Personally I think that's just poor service. I was still pretty cold, and the chairs outside are not as comfortable when its 25 out once again.  ~Extras/Rating~ Everything said, this place is a popular spot and I had to see it for myself. It may be a good spot to hang out with the guys, given some beer specials for parties of two or more. I usually fly solo on football Sundays. Not many Ravens fans out in the valley ... that'll do it too. I do not knock this place, 3 stars for being a round-about average bar with average food and service. Its a bit generic, but will fill the need for a sports bar if you are in the general area. I would recommend it to others looking to go out for a generic bar atmosphere in the area. I have to mention that Arcadia Tavern, which is right down the street, is in my eyes a much bigger improvement over this Zipps.

u3NXc_R1ZgY98-4tNiEfBw.text: So very sad how this Zipps has gone so down hill!  Terrible service and food is just as bad now. Corporate office has to step in and fire all the mgmt and start fresh. Won't return to this Zipps for sure

efsi7dKi-O5WTVPgQyEBeg.text: Sweat shop or bar? Literally 92 degrees, talked to the manager and (RISSOLVED NOTHING) pretty much told us sucks to suck and the air was (BROKEN)

xdD4TqXs28n4kdWv_FPvmQ.text: Only thing good here tonight was the Zipparitas. We ordered 2 hamburgers, chilli, and zipparitas. They served us cold chili and when we told the waitress she suggested to go warm it up in the microwave, so we canceled our whole order. When we told the manager, he gave us the impression of not caring so we paid for our drinks and left. I will never go back to this location, but the one on mill has better food.

O9pMFJSPg80YVzpMfNikxw.text: My favorite sports bar in Phoenix. Nice outdoor seating, lots of indoor too. Big TVs everywhere. Nice servers. Now to the food. ******Get the Medium Buffalo Wings.****** I am in sweet, sweet love with these wings. I never want to get wings anywhere else. They're just a bit spicy but don't burn your face off. I don't like to share with my husband... These wings might cause family strife. They're that good.

LtoxqgNAHNIF5rx4cjSahg.text: This Zipps is a great sports bar. The food is good and moderately priced. They're known for the Monaco Foccacia just like all of the other zipps. Just a good spot to bring your friends, grab some beers, and watch some sports!  I recommend this zipps to anyone!

vzHqOpn4ujo9QRVw8JYVFw.text: Came in early for a small work event. I arrived early to reserve a table for six as it was Monday Night Football. The hostess refused to sit me at a table of 6 but instead a table of 4. When I was seated I explained to my server that I need a table of of 6. She also refused to seat me. I then watched my server go to the hostess to gossip about my unfortunate situation as they both turned to look and smile.  I don't know what's worse, not getting the table I need or watching the people supposed to help me gossip and snicker behind my back. Worst. Service. EVER!!!

70MrWbV1Cfc98xhGLjEPJQ.text: If you ever just want burger and a drink. Great bar. Keep their burger prices away from the 12 to 18 dollar level. It's refreshing to see a place that offers good food at a good price. Servers at the bar are pleasant tans make sure you get great service. Good place....

se8I4zAhrOv8TYj3mYX9tw.text: I've been mulling over this review for quite a while now.  You see, I was torn because it has good points and bad points and I was deciding how to handle this.  But my decision is finally made. The ambiance is nice.  Much more upscale/trendy than tried and True but tired Hazelwoods across the street.  The food is adequate/OK/good/tasty--but is basically re-invented bar food. The food prices are,  IMHO, about $1 more per item than they should be for the quality that you get. $9 burgers.  $8 wings  The patio looks cozy and inviting and I'll bet I would be very happyout there if I could just bully my companions into sitting outside for a change  I've tried to sit outside every time I've gone and every time, I get outvoted.  :(  Oh well, it probably reeks of smokers anyway I guess.  :/  Happy Hour prices are just so-so. This is not an expensive bar, but it is not a particularly cheap bar either-you can tell what kind of liquor licence they hold by the high cost of alcohol and the relatively inexpensive food. All in all, it would have been a solid 4 star review--except for two things.  One minor issue and one MAJOR issue. Minor one first.  I find the tables and chairs uncomfortable.  The pub height AND the regular ones.  The major one is a short story. 5 of us, Happy Hour, watching a game, ordering food and masses of beverages.    The waitress comes by to check and see if we want to order anything before Happy Hour ends.   We start discussing beers with her and she talks us into a premium beer by pointing out that we save 4 dollars a pitcher during HH.  So we order 2--and some more food. When it came time to leave, we noticed that the premium beers and all of the food ordered when she came to check on us (remember she was taking orders before HH ended?) ALL FULL PRICE. An extra $22.00. When we pointed it out, she couldn't have cared less.  Simply shrugged and said the computer decides the prices based on the time the order is entered. Wasn't she the one that wasted  time talking us into the premium pitchers?  You bet!  That dropped this down from a solid 4 to a shaky 3.

qvQbmsXKmADNcFJGtsahPQ.text: Today was the worst experience ive ever had at this zipps. The service is great during the night and absolutely horrid during the day.   My dad and I sat down as usual. It took 10 minutes for the young blonde server to come over and ask for drinks. We did not get our coffee for another 10 minutes when the regular coffee was already made as she said. Then the creamer my server gave me was lumpy and had gone bad. I empties the creamer into my coffee only to see lumps and flakes of white float to the top of my coffee.  As this happens, I look over and see the servers standing around at the kitchen Window laughing, my server included. The management was back laughing with the team members as well and you could mistake him for another server thats lazy on a slow day.  Just because its slow does not mean the team can be slow. Im a regular customer and I will not come back during the day.

dp0cPW8YQqJuE70Xet2jPg.text: Food is not very good at all. And the service was awful. Was here for two hours by myself and it took forever to get seated to get a drink and to order food.

XPNQxlSz-GK04yq0wNMBAw.text: This was such an odd experience! I usually go to the Zipps on 16th St. and Bethany and have always had a great time. We went to the Indian School location on a Monday (Memorial Day) for lunch and drinks. It was dead - I am pretty sure our server had two tables. The initial greeting when we sat was quick and careless. I didn't really think twice about it, maybe she was having a bad day or frustrated because it was dead. I completely get that servers have bad days too.   My friend and I hadn't seen each other in about six months so we were slow to order. We were enjoying our conversation and drinks (which I completely recommend - the frozen margarita with the strawberry puree). If it were slammed I would have picked up the pace a bit but there was a total of about ten people in the entire place. The service got increasingly short and rushed as if we did something to offend the server.   As I think back on it I know we did not ask for anything out of the ordinary and we were not being obnoxious so I am still confused. We started with wings - which were great (per usual). We then ordered a couple of sandwiches. The server would not even look at us as time went on. We ordered a couple sandwiches and my friend requested an extra side of ranch. The guy who delivered it (I am assuming was the manager on duty) did not say a word to us or look at us. I was sure to say "thank you" and I got no response. The sandwiches were nothing to write home about although at the other location I have had delicious ones. We ended up just asking for the check because of the situation. When she would come to ask if we needed anything she did not stop at the table it was like "need anything" as she was walking by.   It became almost awkward because I was so confused by the service or the lack of. I am even finding it hard to explain why it was such a negative experience. It takes a lot for me not to tip at least 20% and in this case I ended up tipping around 10% because of the situation.   On top of it I was running in to the house to puke when I arrived home. So I guess this experience was also my first case of food poisoning. After about 6 hours of puking, sweating, and napping I was still rethinking what we could have done to offend the server.   OH I did ask to turn down the music a tiny bit because Brittany Spears was blaring! Maybe that is why....if so - I am sorry, I didn't mean to ask something so out of line.

ZanXl929Sy-caCmw2BWPhg.text: Let's cover what's good...  Believe it or not, their food is very good for a sports bar. You wouldn't think it would be but it is. In addition, lots of TVs so every seat and table has a good view of several different games playing.  But as everyone knows, it's how they run the restaurant that makes it or breaks it.  This is where they fall down. I came in for Monday Night Football and they ran the Suns game through the central speakers instead if the game.    Asked the manager how come... His answer, "because that was what was first requested".  So I asked, "whoever comes in first, sits down gets to decide what gets pumped through the speakers"? He said yes.  Unbelievable! I sure hope nobody comes in early on Sunday and requests figure skating.  90% of everyone at Zipps was there for Monday Night Football but, instead, we listened to the Suns game.  Management needs to be changed!  I'm heading across the street to Hazzelwoods next week... I bet they'll know what to play on Monday Night!

cOsSG0yvYK2hp7w286dCzA.text: I thought I'd give it another try but another disaappinment waited almost a half hour for a lunch plate... Club sandwich. Not difficult at all. The place was not even busy. I know I will not revisit any Zipps in town this was my third location and again it was a fail. Lesson learned. Note the food was tasteless and after waiting I did not want my meal anymore

kC3CTu2xyvwtgTclnZBL0A.text: I love this place and on top of it, you guys have great margs, everyone knows that but this server came out and brought me my purse. I would have forgotten it otherwise! So thank you so much

K9LFAcNI3tXysT9mkvil5g.text: I was a little grossed out when I saw baby roaches crawling across the bar multiple times. Maybe it was the green beer that attracted the bugs LOL. There was food being served on the bar and grossed me TF out!! I recommend ownership spend a little money and hire a pest control company #healthdeptmustvisit!!

I0o0HzI-oljOZP6v-OYvHg.text: My boyfriend is a former NHL Hockey player from the late 70's, early 80's.  Needless to say, he 'needs' his hockey!  With pucks and sticks, he likes yummy wings, and the facaccia  ( yes, I know it is spelled wrong ) buffalo wrap with extra chicken for only $2 plus a side of wing sauce.  He loves the fries which always come HOT and OILY, and I love the salad with their yummy blue cheese dressing with extra chunks of cheese on top.  The service is good and they remember us there.  We like the ZIPPS in Tempe outside seating for a change of pace.    ENJOY !

Nj1UPce4xbxs6SiZyrczqw.text: Only here because Chrissy is still working here, she's the best. My friend likes coming here cause of the patio. Chrissy took care of us again....she's the only reason we return

skzV4xm3hHCn3-lT8n-CvQ.text: Wow, I heard the food was great here. Don't bother. The fries were cold & soggy, the onion rings were greasy and burnt, the fish was soggy and the tartar sauce was gritty and warm. All that after 45 minutes waiting. I will never go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Zipps Sports Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Icky food

iawe8wn4fXL-f_bWtAtVKg.text: Monaco Focaccia (sp?) Yes, please! With a side of sweat potatoe chips, be careful though, they tend to over do the chips and have to send them back, sad face. Man are they good when done right though!  Chicken Caesar salad is large and filling if you just need a salad.  As for drinks, meh, decently priced for a bar & grill.  Visit Zipps a few times a month.

5uw8MDUtloqXh8sWHWH41w.text: I love the turkey chili that they have here! It is by far the most tasty, meaty and flavorful turkey chili i have ever had- hands down- AMAZING!   Now, nothing else on their menue is good, from my expereince, but the chili is enough to keep me coming back for more!

D8VluKXRqLI8OzzN4AFC3g.text: I hate the my star rating on this Zipps keep falling, but it does. Each time we have stopped in the last few months things have taken a serious down turn.   Myself and my husband and his friend stopped in for a last min dinner a few weeks ago. Starving! we ordered some wings right away. It was still happy hour thankfully so we splurged and got two orders to share. They took forever it seemed like, and yes I know that fried wings take longer to make, but this was like 35 min, too long. The waitress didn't seem to eager to return to the table very often, our drinks went very empty for awhile. If you know anything about their soda and water glasses you know it is hard to consume them entirely, they are huge, but we did. She finally came back to take our order and it didn't seem to translate to the computer very well. All of our orders came out wrong. No sauce or veggies on my sandwich, fries that were clearly refried because they were let to get cold in the window, they had soaked up so much oil I couldn't choke them down. It isn't like we made a ton of changes, just added lettuce to a sandwich, and got a few extra sides of dressing. After waiting nearly 15 min to find a server to come help us, we expressed our issues and requested that the food be taken back to fix, she rushed away so fast that I didn't have a chance to ask for a roll up to eat my salad or request some more water. I am 8 months pregnant and dehydrate and frustrate easily. I tried to keep my cool, but honestly they were very slow and this was just ridiculous. Once our corrected food came back to the table it still wasn't right, but I was too hungry to care by that point and just ate.   She still took forever to come check on us and bring the check.  I am more writing this review in hopes that management sees and works to correct the slack services and the unfortunate kitchen mistakes. Side note, I know its a corporate thing, but charging $1 for a side of ranch is ridiculous. Makes customers feel nickel and dimed and annoyed. Maybe reconsider.   I will be back, but probably one more shot before I take it off the list entirely.

kUhbtuIMyYqK1JmXt8boPg.text: Service is good here most of the time as is the food, seldomly have issues with slow beer delivery.

nJHALypEfrNiXswab12J8Q.text: Ok let me start off by saying although I'm a pregnant lady, I don't expect special treatment. However, with another human growing inside you, being hungry is serious business. Thankfully, I wasn't starving when I arrived at Zipps. We were seated promptly and the waitress got our drink order right away. Unfortunately, everything went downhill from there. She did not return to our table and after 15 minutes, I got up and flagged her down to take our order. Then the wait began. Our waitress never returned to check on us. More then 45 minutes passed before she came back and said our food would be out soon. Another 15 minutes passed and still no food. After waiting over an hour for a salad and sandwich, we finally left without eating. Seriously disappointed.

ewKpu2qHKXUC9z_69GrEgw.text: Oh dear, how awful! 13 dollars for a wrap type of Pannini sandwich, cold fries and not very good Sweet potato chips that they swear are homemade. Hmmmmmm!  I came home to food poisoning and I have a flight to catch tomorrow. I did like the Jalapeno dipping sauce but what's the point if there is no good food to dip in it? The servers were very nice, and the televisions with sports were a plenty if that's your thing but the food was terrible.

jhJK-206GYQw6Ky6b_R4qQ.text: Food is horrible seems like it's all microwaved. Pizza had no taste and looked like rubber. Service was pretty slow. Wouldn't go back

3pGHzXVgaKQSaneE2ybwJA.text: I've been In here countless times, and actually like this location but yesterday I was turned down a table because it "sat 4 people" although I've sat at the same table before with less than 4 people. I was given a menu with multiple Cup stains but with goo on it guessing from the zipparitas and in addition to that, an hour later I find that two staff members are sitting In the same exact booth I asked for. I understand if you wanted to reserve that booth for guests of more than two to catch the game, but the fact that you allowed TWO staff members to sit at that booth that you couldn't allow TWO customers to sit at during the game is a joke. Our server was great, attentive and did a great job during a busy crowd.

F5P_WSS93v035VB81xZfpA.text: 5 Stars to the staff behind the bar.  Unfortunately everything else is 1 star.  This Zipps used to be a great hangout and I enjoyed it regularly, but now I only make an occasional visit to see a couple of friends. The last two times I have ordered food to go I should have checked before leaving. The zipparitas are loaded with so much Sun Orchard Margarita Mix that heartburn is almost immediately triggered. Sad

8btLuS7fyddr2kdNbEFqmA.text: The atmosphere is standard for a sports bar, but it's the food that really stinks. I have been here a few times and I'm always kind of grossed out by what I get: soup, fries, etc. It all tastes frozen or canned. I won't go back.
